quote: My heart says, ‘This way.’ The world says, ‘That way.’ God says, ‘I am the Way.’ And if perchance I choose to listen to the first two, I’m going to find myself so far off the ‘way’ that being lost becomes the ‘way’.

quote: If the light we have is continually engulfed by the darkness in a way that makes the darkness even darker, maybe we should think about getting our light from Someone else before it gets a whole lot darker.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: The best I can do is to ‘pretend’ that I’m my own god. But in the pretending I have to pretend that I’m not pretending, and somehow that doesn’t sound very god-like to me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, deceive, deception, distort, distortion, ego, egocentric, fake, faking, god, greedy, idol, idols, lying, narcissistic, pretend, pretending, self-centered, selfish, selfishness

quote: To deny the battle is unwise. To believe that I can fight it without God is insane. To actually do so is suicidal. No wonder so many of us walk around looking like death warmed over.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: battle, battles, christian, christianity, crazy, dead, death, denial, deny, exist, fight, foolish, foolishness, god, insane, insanity, suicidal, suicide, survival

quote: Suddenly finding myself imprisoned in the ruins of the fortresses I created, I realize that that which I built to protect me has now become a labyrinth that is set to destroy me. And laying spent in the rubble, I finally realize that there is only one fortress and I cannot create it because there is only one God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: boundaries, boundary, captive, christian, christianity, defense, defense-mechanisms, defensive, destroy, destruction, fail, failure, fortress, fortresses, god, imprisoned, jesus, jesus-christ, protect, protection, rubble, self-protection

quote: If you want to completely destroy a child, all you have to do is mold them into your vision of what you want them to be. If you want to completely liberate a child, all you have to do is grow them into the person they were created to be. The former cannot see God in the child. The latter can see nothing less.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: A father teaches his children that the battle is not determined by the enemy that stands around them, but by the God Who stands within them. And that lesson can only be driven home as they watch their father stand around them, while God stands within their father.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: battle, christian, christianity, dad, daddy, enemy, example, father, father-s-day, fatherhood, fight, god, illustrate, mentor, parent, parenting, role-model, struggle

quote: If I choose to take the pen from God and write the story of my life without Him, I better have plenty of erasers and a whole lot of white-out. Better yet, I should invest in a good shredder.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, arrogant, christian, christianity, defiant, eraser, fool, foolish, foolishness, god, independence, independent, jesus, jesus-christ, life, life-story, pen-write, self-destruction, self-sabotage, shredder, story, stubborn, whiteout

quote: Sooner or later I will be faced with the fact that the world is helpless to meet my needs. And at that point, I will be left with two conclusions; that life is cruel or God is real.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandoned, christian, christianity, conclusions, cruel, cruelty, god, helpless, helplessness, jesus, jesus-christ, needs, needy, real, reality, rejected, world

quote: There’s not much that I can find in places where there is nothing to find. However, to avoid facing God I find myself spending a lot of time in those very places.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandon, abandonment, accountability, accountable, avoid, avoidance, christian, christianity, denial, deny, find, flee, futile, god, ignorant, ignore, lonely, meaningless, meaninglessness, myself, nothing, nothingness, places, run, self, surrender, surrendering, time

quote: Maybe what I need to be rescued from is the feeling that I don’t need to be rescued, for without a doubt this is the most difficult rescue of all.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, arrogant, christian, christianity, difficult, ego, egotistical, narcissism, narcissistic, pride, prideful, proud, redeem-salvage, redemption, release, rescue, rescue-mission, rescuing, retrieval, retrieve, salvation, self-centered, selfish

quote: Raw power without Godly obedience is a long walk off a short conscience.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, conscience, discernment, god, godly, guidance, guiding, obedience, obey, power, short, wisdom

quote: Our prayers are something akin to delivering a list, verses surrendering a life. The former will always leave me creating the next list, while the latter will leave me creating a new life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, god, greed, life, list, petitions, prayer, prayerful, praying, requests, selfish, selfishness, supplication, surrendering

quote: With God, the word ‘impossible’ is itself impossible.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplish, accomplishment, achievable, achieve, achievement, christian, christianity, goals, god, implausible, impossible, improbable, objectives, possible, probable

quote: To ascend the mountain, we must descend to our knees.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: challenges, christian, christianity, descend, descent, goals, god, kneel, knees, knelt, mountain, objectives, obstacles, possibilities, pray, prayer, praying, supplication

quote: In one way or another, every mission that I have ever set out on to rescue myself is yet another mission that I end up needing to be rescued from. Hence, there is God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, arrogant, christian, christianity, difficult, ego, egotistical, god, narcissism, narcissistic, pride, prideful, proud, redeem-salvage, redemption, release, rescue, rescue-mission, rescuing, retrieval, retrieve, salvation, self-centered, selfish

quote: If I were to sit down and count them, how many of my prayers were tainted by the seduction of greed? None, simply because nothing of that sort is a prayer.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, contaminate, contamination, ego, egocentric, god, greed, greedy, pray, prayers, praying, seduce, seduction, self, self-centered, selfish, taint, tainted, tempt, temptation, tempted

quote: To attempt to know myself ‘apart’ from God is to choose to know nothing more than ‘a part’ of myself.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: awareness, christian, christianity, god, ignorance, ignorant, introspection, introspective, jesus, jesus-christ, know, knowing, self-aware, self-awareness

quote: God invites. We decline. And because of that single foolhardy decision we spend the rest of our lives ‘declining’.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: choices, christian, christianity, decisions, decline, defeat, fool, foolhardy, god, ignorance, ignore, invitation, invite, life, lives, stupid, stupidity, wisdom, wise

quote: Easter is a time when God turned the inevitability of death into the invincibility of life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, cross, death, easter, god, good-friday, jesus, jesus-christ, life, resurrection, risen, sacrifical, sacrifice, tomb

quote: Greatness untethered from God results in calamity unrestrained by men.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, calamity, christian, christianity, ego, ego-centric, egotistical, god, great, greatness, greed, jesus, jesus-christ, men, narcissism, restrain, restraint, sin, stubborn

quote: Words can be honed to crafted perfection by the finest wordsmiths. Yet, if we trust solely in the expanse of them to explain this God of ours or articulate our experience of Him, we will have brutally destroyed the very things we are attempting to explain. And if I should do that, no words can describe how badly I wish I had no words.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: articulate, christian, christianity, describe, description, desire, explain, explanation, god, understand, verbiage, words

quote: I pray for sufficient wisdom to understand that wisdom apart from God is the stuff of opinion tainted by the rot of bias. And if I am somehow apt to confuse such rubbish with wisdom, I will think myself wise but find myself living in a landfill.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bias, christian, christianity, deceived, discerning, distorted, distortion, god, intuition, intuitive, landfill, opinion, rot, rubbish, skew, wisdom, wise

quote: Easter is God throwing everything at death so that I can give everything to life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christianity, cross, crucifixion-resurrection, death, easter, god, impossible, jesus, jesus-christ, possible, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: Maybe I don’t have enough beginnings in my life because I fought against the endings that were about to birth those beginnings.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: beginning, beginnings, christian, christianity, cross, crucifixion, death, easter, end, endings, god, holiday, jesus, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: Sooner or later I will realize that the very things I most desperately need are the very things I am unable to give myself. Therefore, I will either be left despising the fact that I am doomed to live out a life that is perpetually empty, or I will realize that an empty tomb is the single thing that will eternally fill me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, cross, crucifixion, death, easter, god, holiday, jesus, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: Of course God does outrageous things. But in reality, what insanity would prompt me to follow a God who did anything less?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christianity, cross, crucifixion-resurrection, easter, god, impossible, jesus, jesus-christ, possible, resurrection, tomb

quote: Easter says that every ending ever experienced by man is exquisitely crafted to find its own ending at the feet of a fresh beginning.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christianity, cross, crucifixion-resurrection, death, easter, god, impossible, jesus, jesus-christ, possible, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: There are an incalculable number of things within me that I frantically wish to be emptied of, and despite my most earnest efforts to remove them, they remain. And it is Easter that reminds me that God empties out tombs.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christianity, cross, crucifixion-resurrection, death, easter, god, impossible, jesus, jesus-christ, possible, removal, remove, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: Although I rail against it, death is the dark demarcation beyond which I am at the mercy of my own end. To the contrary, an empty tomb says that my end is at the mercy of God’s beginning.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, cross, crucifixion, death, easter, god, holiday, jesus, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: I am pressed to admit that I don’t have the capacity to understand the bloodied horrors of a cross and the wild exhilaration of an empty tomb. But at the point that I think I completely understand God, I have at that very point humanized Him and in that very action I have lost Him. Therefore, I much prefer to simply marvel.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: amazement, christianity, cross, crucifixion-resurrection, death, easter, god, impossible, jesus, jesus-christ, marvel, possible, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb, wonder

quote: God emptied out that first tomb so that He could turn around and empty out me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, cross, crucifixion, death, easter, god, holiday, jesus, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: A god of the ‘possible’ is no God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, cross, crucifixion, death, easter, god, holiday, impossible, jesus, possible, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: Easter is the final solution to the finality of death.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, cross, crucifixion, death, easter, final, finality, god, holiday, jesus, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: My limitations abruptly define the frighteningly negligible extent of my existence, yet my soul utterly perishes if bound by those very same limits. And does this not somehow evidence both the reality of and need for God?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, cross, crucifixion, die, easter, god, holiday, jesus, limitations, limits, need, needs, perish, resurrection, salvation, soul, tomb

quote: Easter is the invulnerable tale of utter selflessness where at an inestimable cost God did for us what He did not need done for Himself. And that kind of ‘doing’ happens every day.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, cost, cross, crucifixion, easter, god, holiday, jesus, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, selfless, selflessness, tomb

quote: If God has the answer to every question, maybe my appreciation for God should be shaped more by the number of questions and less by the wisdom of the answers.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: answers, christian, christianity, cross, crucifixion, death, easter, god, holiday, jesus, questions, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: We need to know that our limits do not define our limitations. And an empty tomb does exactly that.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christianity, cross, crucifixion-resurrection, death, easter, impossible, jesus, jesus-christ, limitations, limits, possible, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: Reasonably speaking, we can see the cross as entirely possible. But in considering Easter, we see an empty tomb as entirely impossible. And is it possible that God had to do the impossible to finally get our attention?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christianity, cross, crucifixion-resurrection, death, easter, impossible, jesus, jesus-christ, possible, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: Do I dare believe such an absurdly outrageous story that a man would die, lay lifeless in some tomb for three days and then somehow live again? Yet, if I dare to consider it, is that not exactly what I so desperately desire for this lifeless life of mine? And is Easter God’s tenderly outrageous way of telling me that that is exactly what I can have?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christianity, cross, crucifixion-resurrection, death, easter, god, impossible, jesus, jesus-christ, life, lifeless, meaningless, possible, resurrection, sacrifice, salvation, tomb

quote: Of course I fall. Yet, I incessantly blame my falls on circumstance so that I can deny my own inadequacy and therefore remain my own god. And so, I am left to ask which will come first, the fall that kills me or the surrender that saves me?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: blame, christianity, denial, deny, fall, god, justification, save, surrender

quote: If my decisions constantly heed the voice of the world, I can be completely assured that I’m going to end up in a ‘world of hurt.’ If my decisions heed the word of God, I can be completely assured that this ‘world of hurt’ won't be anywhere near my solar system.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: choices, christian, christianity, consequences, decisions, god, guidance, heed, hurt, pain, repercussions, world

quote: If I can somehow focus on the pain of not focusing on my pain, I will soon find that pain healed simply because I forced myself to do the exact opposite of what my core humanity demanded I do…I sought to heal the pain of someone else instead.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, courage, focus, gift, giving, god, heal, healed, healing, humanity, pain, painful, restored, sacrifice, self-discipline, self-sacrifice

quote: The voice incessantly quelled in the chorus of human voices will always be the voice of God. And given a reality of this magnitude, I would be well advised to cease my babbling and encourage those around me to do the same.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: attentive, babbling, christian, christianity, deny, god, god-s-voice, hearing, ignore, listen, listening, silence, silent

quote: I have yet to learn that I am not designed to carry the burden of men. Rather, I am designed to carry the love of God so that I might soothe the burden of men.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: burdens, christian, christianity, difficulties, god, love, love-of-god, men, soothe, trials, yoke

quote: The sure path to tomorrow was plotted in a manger and paved on a cross. And although this sturdy byway is mine for the taking, I have incessantly chosen lesser paths. And maybe it is time to realize that Christmas is a promise that I can walk through the world and never get lost in the woods.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bible, byway, christian, christianity, christmas, easter, future, god, jesus, journey, path, promise, tomorrow, woods, world

quote: Although it pains me, I must admit that I have never found what I ‘need.’ And I am in this place because long ago I took it upon myself to decide what I ‘want’ to need, verses surrendering to what I ‘need’ to need. And thankfully I have realized that God made Christmas everything that I ‘want,’ but more so He made it everything that I ‘need.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bible, christian, christianity, christmas, desires, god, jesus, need, surrender, surrendering, want

quote: In the thoughtlessness of my incessant hurry, I have made God an ‘addendum in’ my life verses the ‘agenda of’ my life. And what I need to hurry up and realize is that with these priorities positioned as such, what I am hurrying to is my own demise.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: addendum, agenda, christianity, demise, god, hurry, hurrying, priorities, rushed, rushing, thoughtful, thoughtless

quote: Despite my incessant desperation, I simply cannot paint the perfect picture within which I would wish to live out my life. And because I cannot, God picked up the brush of love, positioned the canvas of history and painted a manger.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bethlehem, brushes, canvas, christianity, christmas, god, jesus, life, manger, paint, painted, picture, wish, wishful

quote: I find that I spend a tremendous amount of time chasing the praises of men rather than sitting with the praises of God. The former is something I attempt to catch, the latter catches me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: catch, christianity, dependent, god, praises, pursuing, reinforcement, validation

quote: If my decisions constantly heed the voice of the world, I can be completely assured that I’m going to end up in a ‘world of hurt.’ If my decisions heed the word of God, I can be completely assured that this ‘world of hurt’ isn’t anywhere near my solar system.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christian, christianity, decisions, god, hurting, influence, influenced, obedient, painful

quote: I huddle in the dark with a mass of burnt matches strewn at my feet. And yet, for all of those matches I’ve not been able to light a single candle. And huddled in such deep darkness, I’ve somehow yet to realize that Christmas made both matches and candles forever obsolete.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bible, candle, christian, christianity, christmas, dark, god, jesus, light, matches

quote: The most formidable way to lead is to serve. And while the perplexing oxymoron of such a grinding statement absolutely cripples us, it birthed a Savior.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christianity, christmas, crippled, cripples, god, jesus, jesus-christ, lead, leadership, oxymoron, savior, servant, servanthood, serve

quote: Why in the world have we never found what we’re really looking for? Because what we need is often the very thing we won’t accept. And sadly, in turning away the God we need, we need to understand that we have chosen to live without everything we need.

category: accept, acceptance, calling, christian, christianity, christmas, god, holidays, jesus, jesus-christ, life, live, living, meaning, mission, need, needs, purpose, search, searching

quote: Is my faith so terribly pathetic that I have diminished God to the point that I doubt His ability to survive in the very world that He came to save? Indeed, I have done exactly that. And all I need to do to beat that mentality is to remember that a baby born in a manger with every disadvantage imaginable stills lives today.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: baby, bible, christianity, christmas, eternal, faith, god, holidays, infant, jesus, jesus-christ, manger, salvation, survive

quote: The worst defeat of all is to surrender without having been defeated. And it is Christmas that obliterates both.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christianity, christmas, defeat, defeated, faith, god, holidays, jesus, jesus-christ, surrender

quote: To grasp love, I must grasp the fact that it is a creation of God and therefore it is forever beyond me. But the very fact that it is forever beyond me is the very thing that prompts me to forever pursue it.

quote: Possibly the most debilitating deception of all is to create a god of my own making, fool myself into believing that this limp god of mine is the true God, and then construct the entirety of my life on this flamboyantly fictional character. Possibly the most devastating realization of all is when the real God shows up, and in the showing up all of this come crashing down.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bible, bow, christian, christianity, deceit, deception, fabrication, false-gods, falsehood, fiction, fictional, god, idol, idolatry, idols, illusion, king, sin, sinful-false, throne, worship, worshiping

quote: I often think myself to be so ingenious that I don’t even realize that my own plans may actually be my own undoing. Therefore, I might be wise to realize that God’s plans undo what I’ve done that’s undoing me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, bible, biblical, christian, christianity, ego, egocentric, egotistical, failure, god, ingenious, plans, sabotage, self-sabotage, strategies, undoing, undone, wisdom, wise

quote: To only see ‘death’ in death is to somehow assume that death itself is a barrier so abrupt that God Himself is halted by it. To see ‘life’ in death is to understand that death is a sprawling horizon to a new beginning that God created long before death ever thought to show up.

quote: The promises of God hold up long after the promises of the world have blown up.

quote: God has given me both the right and privilege to outrun Him if I so choose. Yet, if I do so, I will have lost the race.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accept, bible, christian, christianity, embrace, god, ignore, lost, privilege, race, reject, right

quote: To understand the mysteries of God we must move past the logic of men.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bible, christian, christianity, god, logic, men, mysteries, mystery

quote: Despite my best effort to make myself as large as absolutely possible, life will always be larger than me. That simple fact makes God not only a likelihood, but a necessity.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bible, big, bigger, christian, christianity, evidence, god, large, likelihood, necessity

quote: The greatest men stand on their values and pray on their knees.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: beliefs, christian, christianity, convictions, ethics, god, god-fearing, godly, integrity, leaders, leadership, morals, pray, prayer, praying, standing, supplication, values

quote: The length of the fall is dictated by how far we had climbed. The outcome of the fall is dictated by whether we’re holding on to that which we’re climbing, or we’re letting God hold onto us.

quote: The worst of me is the raw material from which God molds the best of me.

quote: We are quick to surrender that which we deem as long dead, when God is quick to restore that which He deems as never really having lived.

quote: The worst thing that I can do is humanize God. The second worst thing that I can do is deify myself. And the best thing that I can do is to avoid both.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: Rarely do I truly understand the disease which ails me. Therefore, rarely do I truly understand the fix that would cure me. And so maybe I should truly contemplate how rarely I recognize that God understands both.

quote: The extent of God’s grace always eclipses the extent of my grotesqueness. Therefore, I can never be bad enough for God to tell me that He’s had enough.

quote: I cannot create greatness as I can only create weak facsimiles. And in sorting through the innumerable facsimiles around me, I will only happen upon true greatness when I happen upon the true God.

quote: If I must know something in order to believe in it, what I am able to believe in will be severely limited. If I choose to believe in something in order to know it, then what I believe in can be boundless.

quote: If I see God as nothing more than a caricature of history or imagination I cannot do anything less than make myself my own ‘god’. author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: The romantic within us is a harbinger of our deepest desires.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: We must clean the lens of our hearts to see the state of our souls. However, too often the former is too dirty to even know that the latter exists.

quote: Given the lethal enormity of sin and the inestimable value of a single soul, a baby in a manger and a man on a cross makes more sense that anything else I will ever be able to possibly imagine.

quote: Tragedy cleans the windows of the soul by washing away the bias of our lives in the detergent of pain.

quote: Hope is oxygen to the soul, and God is the oxygen of hope.

quote: To lead solely on the behalf of those being led is the utter pinnacle of fatherhood, and it is sad that so few ever stand on the summit.

quote: Undoubtedly, failure is growth in pain’s disguise.

quote: Failure is information encased in a shell of pain.

quote: Thankfully, the nature of pain reminds us of what the ease of pleasure foolishly allows us to forget.

quote: Pain is nothing but growth waiting for us to give it permission to grow us up.

quote: I must be ever so careful to remember that my pain is a precious salve that when used in the service of others can heal a thousand wounds and more. And I must likewise remember that if I do not use it as such, I have done nothing more than wound myself yet again.

quote: It is in opposing the world’s lies that we impose truth in our hearts.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: If my heart is set on pursuing real treasures, my mind must be fixed solely on the privilege of enjoying them and freed of the obsession of owning them.

quote: To live a fantasy is to avoid a life.

category: avoid, avoidance, escape, existence, fantasy, flee, flight, life, reality

quote: My decisions determine my destination long before I ever get there. And once I do get there, I suddenly realize this is not the destination I had in mind because what I had in mind was the fantasy that my denial had created verses the reality my choices crafted.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: decisions, denial, denying, destination, direction, fantasy, goal, goal-setting, goals, objective, target

quote: Through the eyes of men an utterly irrational birth followed by a terribly improbable execution are miscues of the most pathetic sort. And all I can say is that I’m immeasurably thankful that I’ve been given access to the eyes of God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: birth, christian, christmas, execution, eyes, god, holidays, jesus, jesus-christ, manger, thankful, vision

quote: I am far too often the author of terribly poor decisions. Yet I must rest in the unalterable fact that God says I am far better than what the sum total of those decisions would ever suggest.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: author, better, choice, choices, christian, consequences, deciding, decisions, god, hatred, poor, repercussions, self-concept, self-esteem, self-hatred, self-worth, value, worth

quote: The difference between a ‘man’ and a ‘father’ is that the former shares his genes, but latter gives his life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: child-children, commit, commitment, dad, daddy, families, family, father, father-s-day, fatherhood, genes, giving, legacy, male, man, men, parent, parenting, sacrifice, sacrificial, sacrificing, sharing

quote: If a father does not altogether embrace a life of uncompromised sacrifice as the core of all principles by which he nurtures his children, he is a father by birth only and no power on earth can ever or will ever make that sufficient.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: child, children, dad, daddy, family, father, father-s-day, fathers, guidance, holidays, nurture, nurturing, parenting, parents, sacrifice

quote: Have we ever thought to consider that the need to be loved grows because of its absence, but that love also grows because of its presence? And does this not speak to the power of love?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: absence, love, loving, loving-kindness, need, passion, passionate, power, power-of-loved, presence

quote: We’re making our decisions … or so we think. Yet in truth, ignorance, greed, and the scourge of immediate gratification are often the things that are making them. So if we’re going to truly live well, maybe the first thing we need to decide is who’s deciding.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: control, decide, deciding, decisions, direction, goals, gratification, greed, ignorance, immediate, influence, power

quote: What insanity would lead me to believe that I possess the power, much less the aptitude to manipulate all of the consequences out of all of my decisions?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: aptitude, consequences, decisions, deluded, delusional, ego, egotistical, insanity, manipulate, manipulation, misinformed, misled, power

quote: If I have not been both soothed by love and on the opposite extreme left devastated by it, I will never understand its power nor respect its majesty.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: devastation, love, loved, loving, majesty, passion, passionate, power, romance, valentine-s-day

quote: I feign fullness, but in reality I am achingly empty. And it is because I too often sit at the table of the world instead of the feet of God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: empty, feet, feet-of-god, full, fullness, god, hollow, priorities, priority, searching, seeking, table, world

quote: If I see only my bias, I have surrendered to a single myopic lens through which to view the world. If I dare to surrender my bias, I will spend the rest of my life seeing the world and throwing away lenses.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bias, biased, clarity, life, limited, living, myopic, opinion, perspective, point-of-view, surrender, viewpoint, vision, world

quote: It is my wish and most cherished hope that God would be pleased with my legacy, that lives would be changed by it, and that the world would be immeasurably better because I was privileged to leave a legacy at all. And if perchance I am fortunate enough to have these things come to pass, I can then rest in the fact that I have lived well.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: god, impact, influence, legacies, legacy, lives, memorial, memorial-day, memories, transformation, world

quote: If the amount of times we get up is just one less than the amount of times that we've been knocked down, then we're spending our lives lying down.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: commitment, courage, defeat, determination, fortitude, tenacity, victory

quote: With God, a mountain before me is soon to be a memory behind me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: barriers, belief, challenges, courage, determination, faith, fortitude, goal, goals, god, memories, memory, miracles, mountain, obstacles, tenacity

quote: To grow is not to timidly sit on some safe shore at water’s edge and clumsily grab whatever happens to float by me. Rather, it is to deliberately step into waters both calm and turbulent in order to wrestle great things to shore.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bold, challenges, courage, daring, determination, determined, float, grab, growth, intentionality, life, risk, risky, sacrifice, shore, wrestle

quote: A commitment to never getting knocked down is in reality a decision to never stand up.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: commitment, committed, courage, decision, decisions, determination, goals-quotes, passion, stand, standing, struggle, tenacity

quote: I can bow to fear and flee the pursuit of great things. I can bow to God and engage in the pursuit of making things great.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: courage, fear, goals, god, greatness, persistence

quote: What I’ve yet to realize is that each time I work to avoid that which I fear, I have in that very same action forfeited the blessings that my fear blinded me to. And I’ve yet to realize that with God, the blessings will always and forever eclipse whatever I fear despite how absolutely imposing those fears might be
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accountability, avoidance, blessings, courage, fears, god

quote: I want to stand on the foundation of ethics and morals when the world around me would assault that foundation with all of its collective might, and in the standing I want to stand on the truth that that foundation will stand long after everything that has assailed it has itself has ceased to stand.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: courage, courageous, ethics, morals, taking-a-stand, truth

quote: I want to stand on the truth that God has designed us to stand, and that the opportunity to stand is the opportunity to live exuberantly and gloriously.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: courage, courageous, god, standing-your-ground, taking-a-stand

quote: Mediocrity is the companion of passivity and will not heed the call of great things. Courage is the companion of sacrifice and cannot help but heed the call of great things. And we are left of our own accord to choose one or the other.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: courage, courageous, mediocre-people, mediocrity, passivity, sacrifice

quote: To live safely within the realm of possibility is to know nothing other than that which is possible. To live boldly within the realm of God is to experience everything that’s impossible.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: courage, god, god-s-plan, impossible, possible, sacrifice

quote: I’ve always marveled that geese can feel a call stirring, rise on hardy wings to engage it, and without contemplation, compass or map complete the feat. And could it be that they achieve this astounding accomplishment because far too often contemplation, compass or map rob the call by sterile analysis when we should liberate the call through expectant obedience.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplishments, calling, contemplation, geese, map, mission, obedience, passion, rob, surrender

quote: One of the most terrifying questions of all might be, ‘Will I unleash myself to live before death unleashes me from the ability to be unleashed?’ And in retrospect, maybe it’s not the question that’s terrifying. Maybe what’s terrifying is the answer.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: apathy, freed, goals, liberated, mediocrity, mission, passion, passive, unleashed

quote: Sacrifice is a passion that unleashes everything away from us so that it can be drawn into everyone around us.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: charity, gift, giving, others, passion, release, sacrifice, self-sacrifice, unleash

quote: We focus on the reasons why we ‘can’t’ at the expense of the far greater reasons why we ‘can’.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abilities, ability, attitude, can, can-t, detemination, determined, foresight, fortitude, goal, goal-oriented, impossibilities, passion, passionless, possibilities, stubborn, stubbornness, tenacious, tenacity, vision, visionless

quote: What I do is the truest mirror of who I am.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: authenticity, choices, identity, mirror, passion, performance, reflection, self-concept, self-esteem, self-understanding, value

quote: Once I have impounded love and towed it into the confine of words, I have lost it altogether.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: confined, impounded, language, lose, lost, love, loved, passion, towed, words

quote: The roads of life are paved wide and skirt the mountains. And these very roads are choked with a steady stream of pathetically pedantic travelers who in reality have no intent of traveling. And if we are to discover the real travelers, much less join them, we will find them out on precarious paths that defy the roads and scale the mountains.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, challenges, journey, living, mission, mountains, passion, paths, road-of-life, travel, traveler

quote: God’s decision to reach out in such dramatic fashion as to lay all rightful privilege aside and be born into abject destitution tells us that His passion for us exceeds our desire for Him. And maybe we should commit to evening that up a bit.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christmas, compassion, desire, destitution, dramatic, god, holidays, jesus, jesus-christ, passion, sacrifice

quote: The eyes of love have 20/20 vision when focused on another, and become entirely blind when focused on ourselves.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: another, blind, blinded, caring, eyes, focus, focused, giving, love, lover, loving, nurturing, others, passion, priorities, sacrifice, sacrificing, self-centered, self-sacrifice, selfish, selfishness

quote: In our frenzied attempts to catch up with life, we run right past it. Once we have run past it, what we are in reality attempting to catch is ourselves.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplish, achieve, achievements, beat, catch-up, challenge, chase, driven, goals, life, ourselves, overcome, passion, race, run, self, us

quote: I have diligently disciplined my life to search out life’s gifts in the places where life stores its scraps.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: deceived, desire, determination, disappointed, discipline, gifts, life, living, misinformed, misled, passion, scraps, search, searching, seek, seeking

quote: God beckons me to exhilarating adventures that are without number, beyond all conceivable boundaries, and effortlessly eclipse the furthest reaches of my imagination, all while I sit languishing in stifling adventures of my own limited creation.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: adventure, calling, god, jesus, jesus-christ, journey, life-journey, passion

quote: Mediocrity is ‘purpose’ left to rot in minds ensnared in the deluded rationalization that vision is nothing more than a collection of fanciful dreams constructed by an imaginary God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, god, justification, mediocrity, passion, purpose, rationalization, vision

quote: If left to my own simplistic devices and the sorely scant limits of my abilities, would I not die a death of the blandest sort imaginable? And should I not thank God that He graciously gifted me with an imagination that renders such a death entirely unimaginable?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: dreams, drive, gifted, god, hopes, imagination, imagine, passion, vision

quote: To lust for something is desire turned selfish and gone mad. To embrace God’s passion is desire turned selfless and gone mindful.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: desire, god, lust, passion

quote: To be ignorant of the sacrifices of others that yielded the blessings I enjoy leaves me exchanging the reality of 'blessing' for the assumption of 'entitlement.' And once that happens, I will forfeit the reality of the former which will destroy the assumption of the latter. And in what terribly dark place will that now leave me?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: america, appreciate, appreciation, assumption, blessing, blessings, cherish, cherishing, entitled, entitlement, fourth-of-july, gift, gifts, give, giving, memorial-day, reality, sacred, sacrifices, sacrificing, united-states, united-states-of-america, value

quote: If truth is relative, then it’s cousin is anarchy.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: absolute, anarchy, confusion, cousin, disorientation, fact, honest, honesty, lies, lying, misdirected, misdirection, reality, relative, truth

quote: We live with this tortured feeling that we must create that which in reality we have the privilege of finding.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: adventure, build, create, develop, discover, exploration, feeling, feelings, find, finding, gift, journey, opportunity, privilege, reality, tortured

quote: I can only begin the process of saving myself when I surrender to the reality that I can’t. And what greater place to surrender that reality than to an infant who surrendered Himself to me so that I might surrender myself to Him.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christmas, god, holidays, inability, infant, jesus, jesus-christ, manger, reality, salvation, save, saving, surrender, surrendering

quote: No person, collection of people, institution, government or organization of any kind can in any way promise to meet all of my needs for no person, collection of people, institution, government or organization possesses the array of resources necessary to do that. And so, I am left with the reality that either there is a God who can meet all of my needs, or I’ve been stranded in an existence that created me with needs that the existence itself cannot meet.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandoned, creation, disappointed, disappointment, empty, evolution, god, hopeless, hopelessness, intelligent-design, needs, reality, rejection, stranded, unmet

quote: Have we ever thought to consider that God allows things in our lives to die so that in that death we might come to the precious realization of how little we’ve actually lived in the first place?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: allow, allows, aware, awareness, consider, consideration, death, dying, god, illustrate, instruct, life, lived, precious, quality-of-life, reality, realization, realize, reveal, show, teach

quote: Disappointment focuses on ‘what is not,’ and completely misses the far greater reality of ‘what now is.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bypass, disappoint, disappointment, discouraged, discouragement, focus, forsake, forsaken, misdirected, misinterpreted, missed, optimism, pessimism, reality

quote: I can attempt to stay on the fence. However, the problem is that the fence is a figment of my fear not a reality of my journey.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: apprehension, fear, fears, fence, figment, frightened, journey, life, reality

quote: It is the length of the journey that ripens the joy of the outcome.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: journey, joy, length, outcome, patience, patient, ripen

quote: Abundant living is realizing that life is a privilege whether it’s adhering to our scripts or not.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abundance, abundant, desires, disappointed, disappointment, discouragement, disillusioned, disillusionment, goals, happiness, happy, joy, joyful, living, plan, privilege, rights, scripts

quote: We have a choice. We can be jaded by what we’ve lost, or joyous over what that thing had accomplished while we had it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplished, achieve, achieved, choice, choose, grief, grief-and-loss, jaded, joy, joyful, joyous, loss, losses, opinion, perspective, point-of-view

quote: Is it reasonable to assume that the jarring nature of a particular consequence might be the very thing that strong-arms us away from making the poor choice that we didn't see as a poor choice?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: wisdom-quotes

quote: However, in many instances we might be very wise to ask what the consequence of removing the consequence might actually be.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: wisdom-quotes

quote: If we fail to instill a fixed sense of confidence in our children, we will raise handicapped children who have no handicap other than the conviction that they believe they do.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: belief, believing, child, children, confidence, confident, conviction, father, father-s-day, handicap, handicapped, ingrain, ingraining, inheritance, kids, legacy, mistaken, mother, mother-s-day, nurture, nurturing, parent, parenthood, parenting, perception, raise, upbringing

quote: A ‘good’ father will tenderly cultivate his children. But a ‘good’ father who is also a ‘brave’ father will let the children without cultivate the child within.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: brave, bravery, child, children, cultivate, father, father-s-day, fatherhood, inner-child, kid, kids, parent, parenting, raise, raising, raising-children, upbringing

quote: It is not that you give birth to a child that matters most. Rather, it is what you birth into them.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: birth, birthing, child, children, dad, daughter, father, impart, kid, mom, mother, parent, parenting, son, teach, train, training

quote: If as an adult I have scolded and then silenced the child within me, I contend that I am neither an adult nor a child. Rather, I am just plain ignorant.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: adult, child, children, choice, choices, fool, foolish, ignorant, inner-child, mature, maturity, naive, scolded, silence, silenced, stupid, suppress

quote: The clash is born of the fact that the child within me sees with undiluted clarity what the adult within me is incessantly working to deny. And in these most vexing moments, to be the adult is to defer to the child.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: adult, avoidance, child, children, denial, honesty, immature, immaturity, maturation, maturity, wisdom

quote: The ‘fact’ of my actions frequently collide with the ‘fiction’ of my words. And at what point will I live what I say, so I will avoid what I do?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: actions, collide, collision, contradict, contradictory, dishonest, distort, distortion, ethical, fact, fiction, honest, honesty, integrity, lies, manipulate, manipulation, moral, truth, words

quote: The problem with the ‘herd’ is that our voice is never ‘heard’.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: complacency, compliance, comply, conform, conforming, differences, different, expectations, heard, herd, independence, independent, laziness, lazy, mediocre, mediocrity, norms, opinion, placate, placating, problem, problematic, societal, society, surrender, surrendering, unique, uniqueness, voice

quote: Apathy is giving up when we need to get up.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandon, apathy, attitude, commit, commitment, determination, determined, focused, fortitude, get-up, give-up, mediocre, mediocrity, retreat, strength, stubborn, surrender, tenacious

quote: I don’t necessarily sit around inviting life to knock me down, but when it does I don’t wait around for an invitation to stand back up either.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: battle, battles, defeat, defeated, determined, effort, invitation, invitations, invite, knocked-down, life, living, persistence, persistent, reversal, reverse, setback, setbacks, tenacious, tenacity

quote: It wasn’t until I slowed the car and rolled down the windows that I realized I spend most of my days driving ‘through’ life without driving ‘in’ life. So, I’ve decided to walk because the pace is slower and the windows are always down.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciate, appreciation, avoidance, avoiding, busy, busyness, car, cherish, diminish, diminished, diminishment, drive, driving, ignorance, ignore, life, living, missing, rush, slow, slowly, value

quote: It’s really a rather simple thing to bring balance to my anger. All I need to do is remember that the ‘hand of cards’ that have been dealt to me pale in comparison to the ‘deck of cards’ that I’ve thrown at others.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandoned, accountability, accountable, anger, angry, betrayed, deck-of-cards, equal, equality, fair, fairness, frustrated, frustrating, fuming, guilt, guilty, honest, honesty, hurt, life, living, offense, remember, responsibility, responsible, self-assessment, unfair, unjust, victim, victimized

quote: The miracle is that the brilliance of the miraculous can live in the blandness of the mundane. The greater miracle is that we have enough brilliance in our own blandness to see it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: banal, bland, blandness, brilliance, common, discernment, insight, live, living, mediocre, miracle, miraculous, mundane, spectacular, uncommon, wonderful

quote: If safety is my goal, living life is not.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, diminish, diminished, existence, existing, goal, life, living, minimize, rob, safe, safety, spoil, steal

quote: We are living out the drama of a pathetic story whose pages are smeared with our own handwriting.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: authorship, consequences, create, drama, handwriting, life, life-story, living, outcomes, pages, pathetic, story, writing

quote: If we’re missing life it’s probably because we’re expecting it to reveal itself to us, rather than realizing that life is revealed by us looking for it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: discover, discovering, expose, exuberant, find, finding, life, living, locate, locating, look, looking, miss, missing, reveal, search, searching

quote: The greatest dividends in life are those that we give away.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bless, blessing, dividends, earn, earned, endow, endowment, generosity, generous, gift-giving, gifts, give, giving, life, living, resources, sacrifice, selfless, selflessness

quote: The worst denial of all is being in denial that we’re in denial in the first place. And I would wonder if that’s not exactly where most of us live out most of our lives.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: denial, deny, ignorance, ignore, justification, justify, life, live, living, rationalize

quote: Maybe we ought to consider that sometimes the most destructive outcomes in our lives are the ones that we’ve created.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: consequence, consequences, create, created, destruction, destructive, fashion, fashioned, formed, life, lives, living, natural-consequence, outcomes, repercussions, results

quote: We can fill our lives with ‘stuff,’ but as we do we’re concurrently filling our lives with the obligation to maintain that ‘stuff.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: acquire, burden, burdens, consequences, fill, hoard, hoarding, life, lives, living, maintain, maintenance, material, obligations, obtain, possessions, repercussions, results, stuff, things

quote: We’ve yet to comprehend the impervious reality that to gain ‘life’ we have to do the most scandalous thing imaginable, and that is to work ‘against’ the whole of our humanity and give everything away. And yet to give everything away is to work ‘with’ the whole of God’s character.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: character, christmas, gain, god, holidays, jesus, jesus-christ, life, living, sacrifice

quote: We can live out our lives, and in the end realize that we never really ‘lived’ a day in our lives.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: day, deceit, deceived, disappointed, fulfilled, fulfillment, life, live, lived, lives, living, misinformed, misled

quote: It may be that we’re not seeing the wonder in life because all we’re doing is wondering how we’re going to survive life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: blind, blinded, life, living, search, searching, survival, survive, surviving, wonder, wonderful, wondering

quote: To live a lie may allow us to avoid the truth, but the real lie lays in believing that we can avoid the truth in the first place.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: avoid, avoidance, belief, believing, deceit, deceitful, honest, honesty, lie, live, living, lying, manipulation, self-deception, truth, truthful

quote: To let something go is to participate in a much greater dance that we call life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: dance, existence, grief, grief-and-loss, journey, life, living, loss, release, releasing

quote: Life is not about getting everything right, as much as it’s about working to live right.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: determination, ethical, ethics, fortitude, integrity, just, life, live, living, morality, morals, right, righteous, righteousness

quote: Our actions in the present build the staircase to the future. The question is whether that staircase is going up or down.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: apathy, backwards, defeat, down, failure, forward, future, impossible, life, living, mediocrity, possible, present, staircase, success, up, victory

quote: We desperately want to believe in something. To simply live out our lives believing in nothing is to live as if this thing we call life is filled with nothing but nothing.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: belief, believe, desire, desperate, desperately, desperation, empty, hope, life, live, living, meaning, meaningless, meaninglessness, nothingness, purpose, purposeless

quote: When will I realize that without God my world is draped in shadows between which there is not a single ray of light? And when will I recognize that with God, my world is deluged in light between which there is not a single thread of darkness?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: darkness, denial, god, god-s-light, illumination, life, light, living

quote: To take this one shot at life and live it with God is to take this one shot and have it reverberate across and around my world as if it were a million shots and more.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: god, impact, life, living, opportunities, possibilities, potential

quote: In too many instances we have settled for a world of our own shaping that is shaping up to be in terrible shape.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: choices, choices-and-consequences, life, living, living-life

quote: Jesus came to give us life to the very edges of life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: jesus, life, living, living-life

quote: To maximize our lives we think that we should get up and join in the race. Yet, we rarely consider that maybe it’s less about joining a race and more about actually creating one.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: creating, destiny, goals, independent, journey, life, race, self-improvement, self-starter

quote: When the world does its level best to devalue me in ways that are nothing short of brutal, all it does is evidence my value. For why would it expend such massive amounts of energy attempting to destroy something that’s not there?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bullying, confident, secure, self, self-assured, self-concept, self-confidence, self-esteem, self-improvement, self-love, self-value, self-worth, value, worth

quote: Could it be that we lost something because had we not lost it, we would have lost ourselves?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: clarity, compass, destiny, lose, lost, map, ourselves, purpose, rationale, reason, road, self, wander, wandering

quote: If life is nothing more than a journey to death, autumn makes sense but spring does not.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: autumn, calling, death, destiny, frustration, futile, futility, journey, life, meaning, mission, purpose, purposeful, spring

quote: In reality, is being sedentary a choice to run from our calling by not running after it?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, destiny, purpose, run, running, sedentary

quote: If I have found my journey to be a maddening tangle of wandering ‘rabbit-trails,’ a labyrinth of incessantly circular passages to nowhere and back, and a plethora of assorted ‘dead-ends’ fraudulently disguised as paths of great promise, it can only be because I have mindlessly exchanged God’s compass for mine. Therefore, it would appear that another exchange might be in order.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, compass, destiny, direction, god, journey, path

quote: To say that my existence is entirely inconsequential is to utterly ignore the amazing reality that life is a masterful story penned by a brilliant God who wrote me into the story in such a way that my absence would literally diminish the whole of the story.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, destiny, god, life, meaning, purpose, story

quote: We can breathe in the sweet scent of a tepid summer’s meadow after the kiss of a warm rain, and in the very same moment we can stand utterly breathless underneath the expanse of untold galaxies that breech the very edges of the universe itself. Such are the privileges we enjoy because of God’s unimaginable imagination.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: creativity, imagination, imagine, majesty, privilege, wonder

quote: The road ahead is not some predetermined path that I am forced to trod, but it is a rich byway that I can help create.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: byway, destination, enslaved, forced, future, journey, new-year, new-years-day, path, predetermined, road, trod

quote: If we’ve somehow become convinced that the script we followed ‘yesterday’ can’t be edited, it will be incredibly difficult to tell the difference between ‘yesterday’ and ‘tomorrow’.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: difficult, future, new-years, new-years-day, past, script, tomorrow, yesterday

quote: The road from ‘here’ to ‘there’ is a map yet to be written with the pen I hold in my hand.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: determination, direction, future, goals, hand, life, map, new-years, new-years-day, pen, road, write, written

quote: Our experiences are the building blocks of the future hewn out of the granite of the present.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: advance, advancing, blocks, building-blocks, experiences, future, granite, growing, growth, lesson, lessons, maturation, maturing, past, present, shaped, shaping

quote: To dress up today in the threadbare garments of yesterday is to create an impoverished tomorrow.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: future, goals, mediocrity, new-year, plans, today, tomorrow, yesterday

quote: I can ruthlessly press my imagination out beyond its very edges, and even in such a remote place I have not begun to touch the barest periphery of God’s imagination.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: future, goals, god, imagination, insight, vision

quote: Starting over is an acceptance of a past we can’t change, an unrelenting conviction that the future can be different, and the stubborn wisdom to use the past to make the future what the past was not.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: easter, future, grief, grief-and-loss, hope, loss, new-beginnings, resurrection

quote: We incessantly vacillate between what’s behind us and what’s before us depending on the current barometer of our courage and the ambivalent nature of our vision.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: future, new-year, past, present, unknown

quote: And so, it is always the case that the past is irreparably land-locked, and the future has yet to land. And here we are, living out our lives on the precariously thin line which separates the two.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: future, past, present-moment, uncertainty, unknown

quote: When I find that stubbornness continually overrides common sense regardless of the logic of my argument, it seems that the only effective solution is to tell them to go ahead and stick their finger in the socket. And what I find is that what my argument failed to solve, electricity does quite nicely.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: argue, belief, bullheaded, consequence, consequences, conviction, convinced, debate, electricity, fixated, ignorance, ignorant, illogical, lesson, myopic, obstinate, outcome, plead, socket, solution, solve, stubborn, stubbornness, surrender, tunnel-vision, unbending, understanding

quote: Five of the most dangerous words I know: ‘What’s in it for me?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: belief, danger, dangerous, ego, egocentric, greed, greedy, myopic, opinion, perspective, self-centered, self-focused, selfish, selfishness, words

quote: Faith means I chose not to know, which is different than ignorance which refuses to know.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: belief, choice, choose, choosing, faith, god, ignorance, ignorant, jaded, know, knowing, refusal, refuse, stubborn, trust, trusting, unbelief

quote: There is that gnawing feeling that we are far more than what we believe ourselves to be. Maybe it’s time to believe the gnawing.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: belief, believe, feeling, gnawing, identity, intuition, intuitive, possibilities, potential, resources, self, self-confidence, self-esteem, self-perception

quote: Most of the things we deem as impossible are only impossible because we’ve given them permission to be impossible.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: achieve, attitude, belief, deem, empower, empowered, empowerment, grant, impossibility, impossible, inclination, observation, opinion, perception, permission, perspective, possibility, possible

quote: Maybe the real miracle in any miracle is our ability to believe that despite our own depravity, in the eyes of God we are worthy of a miracle.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ability, belief, believe, depraved, depravity, despite, eyes-of-god, god, miracle, value, worth, worthy

quote: My first mistake is to humanize God. My second mistake is to hold those wretched human characteristics up against all of the majestic things that I sense God should be. The blatant discrepancy which is certain to ensue then allows me to not only justify my rejection of Him, it grants me unbridled permission to discount His existence altogether. And that third and final mistake is without a doubt the most costly of all.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: belief, denial, deny, discrepancy, existence, faith, faithful, faithless, god, human, humanize, jesus, jesus-christ, justification, justify, reject, rejecting, rejection

quote: Faith is the resplendent key that liberates me from the impregnable confines meticulously constructed from the raw material of my disbelief.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: belief, confines, disbelief, faith, god, liberation

quote: In the deepest darkness God tenderly grasps my hand and whispers that darkness is nothing more than a place that He is preparing for the arrival of light.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: alone, dark, darkness, depression, god, isolation, lonely, sadness

quote: If I am indeed my own god, I’d better start praying to myself to get myself out of myself.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ego, egotism, egotistical, god, narcissism, narcissistic, pray, prayer, prayerful, praying, self, selfish

quote: Prayer is one action where I lay aside my abilities to immerse myself wholly in God’s capabilities. And the liberation found in such an action is less about being engaged with God and more about being freed from myself.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abilities, capabilities, ego, egocentric, engaged, freed, freeing, give-up, god, liberate, liberation, pray, prayer, praying, self, self-sacrifice, surrender

quote: Prayer is knowing that what I ask for is always far bigger than what I could ever articulate, but it is never too big for God to understand nor is it ever too vast for Him to deliver.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: articulate, big, bigger, communicate, god, inadequacy, inadequate, limitations, limits, possibilities, possible, pray, prayer, praying, understand, understanding, vast

quote: My prayer is that God would continue to love me enough to refuse to answer the prayers I'm praying that I shouldn't be praying.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bible, god, intercession, jesus, jesus-christ, love, power-of-prayer, pray, prayer, praying, refuse, wisdom

quote: Starting over is an acceptance of a past we can't change, an unrelenting conviction that the future can be different, and a stubborn wisdom to use the past to make the future was the past was not.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: life-and-living

quote: The issue is becoming so absorbed in positioning ourselves ahead of everyone else that life becomes nothing more than an endless strategy.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: life-and-living

quote: We are about the hurried business of living life while missing it in the very process of living it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: life-and-living

quote: A consequence may be the very thing that saves us because it was the only thing loud enough to get our attention.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: adjust, adjustment, attention, calibrate, consequence, consequences, direct, learn, learning, loud, pay-attention, redirection, save, saves

quote: Instead of the weight that sinks us, consequences are often the life preserver that saves us.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: consequence, consequences, learn, learning, lesson, lessons, life-preserver, perish, perishing, redeem, redeemed, salvation, save, saved, sink, sinking, weight

quote: Sometimes consequences are building blocks fashioned of granite when successes are shaped of clay.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: blocks, building, building-blocks, clay, consequence, consequences, fashion, fashioned, granite, learn, learning, lesson, lessons, shaped, success, successes

quote: It would do me well to realize that the path that has led me to where I am was mapped by those who taught me and paved by what they taught me. Therefore, if God is not my teacher and His truth is not my topic I will find myself where I don’t want to be, having trod a path I didn’t want to take.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: destination, goals, god, god-s-truth, instructed, journey, learning, lesson, lessons, life, mapped, paved, regret, student, subject, taught, teacher, topic, truth

quote: To forget is to blithely toss aside the hard lessons that were hard won by others before us, thereby needlessly dooming us to endure the hard lessons that are likely to be forgotten by those who will follow us. And it is altogether reasonable that in order to avoid this repetitive trouncing, God graciously granted us memories.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: forget, forgetfulness, god, learn, learning, lessons, memorials, memories, remember, remembering, wisdom

quote: I will not find myself, nor will I obtain any precarious morsel of life in giving all of life to myself. If I am ever to find these things, I must first be willing to give these things away at the very moment that I come into possession of them.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: giving, learning, sacrifice, self, self-awareness, self-discovery, wealth

quote: Too often the spotlight that highlights our successes burns out quickly, while the spotlight that scrutinizes our failures is a long-life bulb.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplishments, bulb, burn, burn-out, defeat, emphasis, fail, failure, failures, focus, light, lightbulb, scrutinize, scrutiny, spotlight, success, successes, victory

quote: As it peaks over the horizon, does not a sunrise whisper the opportunity to try again. And if the day passes and our efforts were stunted by the bane of our insecurities or blunted by the challenges of life, does not a sunset invite us to rest before it whispers the same message the next morning?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: begin, beginnings, challenges, end, endings, erase, forgive, forgiven, forgiveness, fresh, insecure, insecurities, life, mulligan, opportunities, opportunity, redeem, redemption, renew, second-chances, slate, start, starting, sunrise, sunset, wipe

quote: I tend to walk around convinced that any amount of forgiveness that I could extend could never possibly compensate for the offenses that I’ve had to endure. Yet, maybe the greater offense is that I’ve got that backwards.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandoned, abuse, abused, backwards, betrayed, compassion, compensate, compensation, forget, forgive, forgiveness, forgiving, hurt, offended, offense, release, ridiculed, used, victim, victimization, victimized

quote: Forgiveness means that you will not allow a temporary event to have “forever” repercussions.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: circumstance, event, events, forget, forgetting, forgive, forgiveness, free, freeing, release, releasing, repercussion, repercussions, temporal, temporary

quote: To forgive is to refuse to contaminate the future with the errors of the past.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: contaminate, errors, forgive, forgiven, forgiveness, forgiving, past, release, resolution, resolve

quote: Forgiving others simply means that you refuse to be a prisoner of a past that you can't change, and shackled to decisions that you didn't make.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: forgiveness

quote: If I have attached anything to sacrifice other than loss, I have at some level assumed a pay-off. And if I’ve assumed a pay-off, I’m only assuming a sacrifice.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: assume, assuming, compensate, compensation, delude, deluded, errant, error, give, give-and-take, giving, loss, losses, misguided, misleading, misled, pay-off, return, reward, rewarded, sacrifice, sacrificial, sacrificing, self-centered, selfish, selfishness

quote: To abandon the child ‘within’ means that the adult ‘without’ will be an adult in name only. And frankly, I can only name a handful of things that are that tragic.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandon, abandonment, adult, adulthood, child, development, growth, immaturity, inner-child, loss, losses, maturation, mature, maturity, personal-development, personal-growth, stunt, stunted, tragedy, tragic, unfortunate

quote: If you haven’t figured it out yet, an absolutely certain way to lose something as quickly as possible is to forget the privilege you have to possess it in the first place.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: blessing, blessings, careless, carelessness, discover, discovered, entitlement, forget, forgetfulness, forgot, forsake, forsaken, greed, ignorance, laziness, lazy, lose, loss, losses, lost, opportunity, owed, possess, possession, privilege, rights, self-centered, selfish, selfishness, stupid, stupidity

quote: Today’s ashes are tomorrow’s soil.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ashes, begin, beginnings, end, endings, grief, grief-and-loss, loss, nurturing, opportunity, soil, start, today, tomorrow, vision

quote: Loss is the uninvited door that extends us an unexpected invitation to unimaginable possibilities.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandon, abandonment, betray, betrayal, death, door, grief, grieving, growth, invitation, invitations, loss, losses, opportunities, personal-development, personal-growth, possibilities, possible

quote: Maybe the thing that we’re losing is the very thing that has caused us to lose everything else in the first place.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: cause-and-effect, consequences, grief, grief-and-loss, lose, losing, loss, outcomes, repercussions

quote: We would prefer all gain and no loss in life, yet that would gain us nothing more than great loss.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: backward, death, dying, failure, forward, gain, grief, grieving, growth, loss, maturation, maturing, opportunities, possibilities, success

quote: Loss eventually arrives when something departs. Grief is working through both.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandoned, abandonment, arrival, depart, departure, empty, grief, grief-and-loss, loss, process, processing, void

quote: The greatest loss lies in our inability to accept loss.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandoned, ability, accept, acceptance, forsake, forsaken, grief, grief-and-loss, inability, lose, loss, losses

quote: A hole is a space where everything has been moved out so that opportunity has space to move in.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: empty, gap, hole, loss, move-in, opening, opportunity, possibilities, possibility, room, space, vacancy, vacuum

quote: Too often my solution is to let something die because I can’t keep it alive, when God’s solution is to let something live because His Son already died for it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: alive, death, died, god, hope, jesus, jesus-christ, live, loss, reclaim, resurrection

quote: God has hewn out a hidden path more glorious, tantalizing and adventuresome than the path trod by most, and it is a path seen only through the eyes of our wounds, felt solely through the heart of our losses, and singularly traversed by those with a limp in their step.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: god, jesus, journey, loss, losses, pain, path-path-of-life, suffering, wounded, wounds

quote: We can’t even remotely fathom that whatever is ending for us is always more than an ending.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: beginnings, beginnings-and-endings, easter, grief, loss, resurrection

quote: Whatever might be taken from me need not leave me with a deficit in its wake.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: grief, grief-and-loss, grieving, injustice, loss, unfair, unfairness-of-life

quote: We myopically stare at the gaping hole left in our lives and see nothing but the hole, not realizing a hole is defined by everything around it that is not a hole.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: loss

quote: In the oddity or maybe the miracle of life, the roots of something new frequently lie in the decaying husks of something old.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: easter, grief, grief-and-loss, new-beginnings, resurrection

quote: We lose the understanding that death always begets life of some sort, and that life is always an opportunist, persistently standing ready to build something out of the smoldering ashes and raise something up out of the tangled carnage.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: beginnings, easter, grief, grief-and-loss, hope, resurrection

quote: There’s something of a restorative quality about spring, where something whispers wild rumors of new beginnings arising from the seemingly dead seeds in our lives. There’s something almost cruel about it all, as if there might be some sort of truth about a new life actually being possible. Yet, maybe it is true.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: easter, grief, grief-and-loss, hope, resurrection, spring

quote: We may find great relief and inexplicable solace in purposefully looking beyond grief in order to determine the provision made within it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: grief

quote: At the end, a journey based on my imagination will leave me imagining that I should have engaged the very thing I used my imagination to avoid.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: avoid, avoidance, death, disappointed, disappointment, duped, imagination, imagine, imagining, journey, life, manipulated, misdirected, mislead, misled

quote: Christmas is God deciding to become what He never had been, so that we can become what we never could be. And so, God does the most improbable thing imaginable. He orchestrates His own birth.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: birth, born, christmas, god, imagination, improbable

quote: Our imagination is God’s ingenious gift that hands us the privilege of romping and playing in realities that we can’t see only because we’ve yet to create them.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: challenges, create, creative, envision, gift, goals, god, imagination, imaginative, ingenious, play, privilege, vision

quote: I often wonder if my imagination is one of God’s choicest gifts bestowed upon me to deliberately break me free from the frequent doldrums of my humanity.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: doldrums, dream, gift, god, imagination, vision, visualize

quote: If I wholly unleash my imagination and forcefully stretch it out beyond its own edges, even at such a point I can only imagine a thin shard of this most immense God. And even though it is but a thin shard, it will nonetheless be mesmerizingly colossal.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: colossal, eternal, eternal-father, god, imagination, imagine, infinite, jesus, jesus-christ, majestic

quote: Dream extravagantly, for God has imbued us with ample imagination to dream out to and across the very periphery of the impossible.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: challenges, dreaming, dreams, god, imagination, imagine, impossible

quote: Without an imagination we would be irreparably shackled to what is, and never be released to what could be.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: imagination

quote: I would suggest that our imagination is a tiny shard of God’s infinite genius that we have within us simply because we were created in God’s image.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: imagination

quote: The greatest imagination in all of existence is one that would be able to take ‘nothing’ and imagine ‘something’ from ‘nothing.’ And that is God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: imagination

quote: Maybe consequences are dear friends in stealthy disguise.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: consequence, consequences, deception, deceptive, disguise, friends, rescue, salvation, stealth

quote: Why is it when I pursue the praises of men I find myself with everything that I’ve looked for but nothing that I need? That’s because I have an extraordinary habit of looking for the wrong thing in the wrong place.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: error, foolish, foolishness, god, men, miscalculate, misjudge, misjudging, misjudgment, needs, praises, praises-of-god, praises-of-men, stupid, stupidity

quote: I incessantly look for water in wells dug by men, and I have drunk enough sand to prove it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: desire, dug, longing, men, quench, refreshment, thirst, thirsty, water, wells

quote: To dream only of what is ‘possible’ is to be fooled into believing that one is dreaming in the first place.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: dream, dreaming, goals, impossible, possible, striving, vision

quote: When surrounded by the ashes of all that I once cherished, despite my best efforts I can find no room to be thankful. But standing there amidst endless ash I must remember that although the ashes surround me, God surrounds the ashes. And once that realization settles upon me, I am what I thought I could never be ... I am thankful for ashes.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandoned, abandonment, ashes, attitude, defeat, discouragement, failure, god, hopeless, hopelessness, jesus, perspective, rejection, setbacks, thankful, thanks, thanksgiving, trials

quote: Today I must look in the mirror and be thankful for the person who I find staring back at me. For although the reflection is terribly imperfect, and I know that full well, God created it with enough room that one day it would be perfect.
