And if there is nothing else I can find to be thankful for, let me begin here.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciation, god, grateful, jesus, reflection, self-confidence, self-esteem, self-image, thankful, thanks, thanksgiving

quote: The Christmas story is penmanship of the most brilliant sort, where God crafted a beginning that would never be subject to an ending.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: begin, beginning, christmas, end, ending, god, holidays, jesus, jesus-christ, manger, penmanship, story, writing

quote: The best way to see majesty is to strip away everything that pretends to be majestic so that which is fake wholly collapses in the face of that which is majestic. And God in a manger is likely the most remarkable example we have of such a monumental truth.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christmas, fake, fraudulent, genuine, god, holidays, jesus, jesus-christ, majestic, majesty, manger, pretend, pretending, truth

quote: I am not the sum total of my accomplishments, for no matter how much I exhaust myself acquiring those accomplishments, the sum total of them will always be far too trifling to ever reflect my true value. My value rests in the fact that I am an accomplishment of God so incalculably valuable that He gave up Himself rather than give me up.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplish, accomplishments, christmas, exhaust, god, jesus, jesus-christ, self-confidence, self-esteem, self-worth, total, value, worth

quote: God chose to deliberately venture into and intentionally occupy depths far below and infinitely beyond that which any human has ever descended, and then to raise Himself back up to glory from those horridly dark places. And I pray that we never miss the fact that Christmas is God’s invitation for us to join Him in the rising.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christmas, dark, darkness, glory, god, holidays, invitation, invite, jesus, jesus-christ, salvation

quote: Christmas embodies everything that I need. However, everything that I need is often made up of a lot of stuff I don’t want.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: authenticity, choices, christmas, decisions, god, honesty, jesus, jesus-christ, need, needs, want, wants

quote: I would like to say that I’m sacrificial. But am I sacrificial enough to acknowledge the fact that I’m not?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: denial, forthright, frank, god, honesty, ignorance, ignore, jesus, jesus-christ, sacrifice, sacrificial

quote: More often than not, rejecting rescue is in reality rejecting our need to be rescued. And it may very well be that is why so many reject Christmas.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christmas, holidays, jesus, jesus-christ, need, reject, rejection, rescue

quote: Perfect majesty that deliberately chose to be born into abject poverty, walk a road of perpetual poverty, and be unjustly executed in the raw nakedness of poverty is utterly ludicrous unless I realize that this is the single and sole way that God can reach me in the suffocating poverty that I myself have created.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: choices, christmas, easter, god, jesus, jesus-christ, poverty

quote: What we’re searching for will determine where we arrive, or if we arrive. And right in the middle of such risky choices, Christmas is God perfectly solving the problem by showing us what to search for and then bringing it to us.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrival, arrive, choices, christmas, deliver, destination, goals, god, holidays, jesus, jesus-christ, meaning, problem, search, searching, striving

quote: It’s not so much about writing the story of Christmas itself, as ingenious as it is. In reality, it’s much more about writing the story of Christmas into the story of life so that it will become the story of life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: birth, christmas, god, ingenious, jesus, jesus-christ, life, story, write, writing

quote: This is the wonder of Christmas, that in the solitary form of an impoverished infant God has handed me everything that I could never create so that I can be everything that I could never be.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: birth, christmas, create, god, holidays, impoverished, infant, jesus, jesus-christ, possibilities, wonder

quote: If I worship the fact that I don’t worship anything, amongst other things what I’m worshipping is denial.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: denial, deny, ego, egocentric, god, gods, jesus, obedience, obey, praise, selfishness, serve, worship, worshipping

quote: What insanity causes a king abandon the comforts of his kingdom and willfully discard the privileges of royalty in order to save an ornery and rebellious people who have spent a lifetime rejecting him? We have yet to understand that such an action is nothing of insanity. Rather, it is everything of love.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christmas, god, insanity, jesus, jesus-christ, love, rebellious, rejection, royal, royalty, sacrifice, salvation

quote: Denial is a seductive ruse of our own making, force-fitting our agendas by forcing out truth all because we bent to fear rather than bowed to God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: agendas, denial, distort, distortion, god, jesus, lies, truth

quote: I would be dreadfully remiss not to think that God would painstakingly craft something an intimately ingenious and inexplicably intricate as my life, and that by virtue of such sheer brilliance I should not examine it with the greatest precision and unleash it with the fullest abandon.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: brilliance, creation, creation-of-god, fortitude, genius, goals, god, ingenious, ingenuity, jesus, potential, respecting-yourself, tenacity

quote: It would be infinitely more prudent to be a single “David” standing with God, than a million “Goliath’s” standing without Him.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: battles, challenges, david, fear, god, goliath, jesus, obstacles, standing

quote: A true work of art is shaped by the hands of another, and if in shaping us that ‘other’ is anything other than God, the piece will never touch the remotest periphery of its potential.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: art, god, growth, jesus, maturity, potential, shape, shaping

quote: Worlds of my own creation are erected with walls that are within but a few scant paces of each other. The world that God creates for me has no idea what walls are.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: creation, freedom, god, jesus, jesus-christ, life, limitations, opportunity, possibility, walls

quote: I ruthlessly expend my time and my energies seeking many random things, none of which will bless me in the way that I suppose they will, for despite my frequently stubborn resistance to the thought, the single and sole blessing that I can be utterly confident in is found in seeking God alone.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: blessing, blessings, god, jesus, resistance, seeking, seeking-god, stubborn

quote: I am wholly deserving of all the consequences that I will in fact never receive simply because God unashamedly stepped in front of me on the cross, unflinchingly spread His arms so as to completely shield me from the retribution that was mine to bear, and repeatedly took the blows. And I stand entirely unwounded, utterly lost in the fact that the while His body was pummeled and bloodied to death by that which was meant for me and me alone, I have not a scratch.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: cross, crucifixion, easter, god, good-friday, jesus, sacrifice

quote: Jesus was and is the greatest restoration specialist of all time.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: healing, jesus, restoration, restore

quote: To strategize a rescue mission irrefutably capable of saving every human being is leagues beyond our ability to comprehend, and enormous beyond any resource we possess to execute. And to embark upon just such a mission fully knowing that without our death the mission will fall to failure is bravery of the greatest sort imaginable. Yet, that is exactly what Christmas is.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: christmas, god, jesus, rescue, sacrifice, salvation

quote: Jesus came to give us life so unimaginably beyond anything that we could ever hope to conceptualize that wonder cannot help but be our constant companion.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: dreams, jesus, wonder, wonderful

quote: Jesus came to give us life without leaving out any of life in the giving.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: jesus, living-life

quote: The key to understanding if something is truly precious is to ask if we can hold it, for things truly precious cannot be held.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: claimed, held, hold, own, ownership, possess, possession, precious, priceless, property, riches, treasure, true-wealth, valuable, value, wealth

quote: Great difficult is the dogged bedfellow of great wealth, which always renders great wealth as less than great. Yet, great wealth as bequeathed by God is robustly free of such travails, which always renders it greater than great.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: assets, blessings, god, greed, money, wealth

quote: It is in building the best of our abilities that we ultimately destroy the worst of our liabilities.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abilities, best, grow, growing, growth, liabilities, maturation, maturing, maturity, persistence, persistent, personal-development, personal-growth, strive, striving, worst

quote: To realize your potential you must look beyond the end of yourself, realizing that where you end is most likely where you actually begin.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abilities, ability, begin, beginning, development, end, ending, growth, maturation, maturity, personal-development, personal-growth, potential, professional-growth, self, self-actualization, spiritual-growth, vision, yourself

quote: The adult within me would be much wiser to learn from the child within me rather than focus on the demand that the child within me grow up.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: adult, child, grow, grow-up, growth, inner-child, maturation, mature, maturing

quote: I fear that should I seek out the treasures around me, they might by comparison reveal that I have not cultivated the treasures within me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abilities, cultivate, invest, investment, maturation, maturity, personal-development, personal-growth, potential, professional-development, professional-growth, resources, treasure, treasures

quote: Undoubtedly, our weariness is not based on the fact that we’re running. Rather, our weariness is all too frequently based on the fact that many of the things that we’re running from are the very things we should be running to.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: direction, fatigued, flee, flight, goals, run, running, tired, weariness, weary, withdraw, withdrawal

quote: The goal of comfort is at the self-same time the abandonment of great accomplishments.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplishments, comfort, comfortable, ease, familiarity, goals, mediocrity, objectives, passive

quote: Due north’ on my compass is largely ‘due’ to the fact that in ‘due’ time I have been ‘unduly’ lax in recalibrating my compass. And I’m apparently ignorant enough to wonder why I’m lost.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calibration, compass, destination, direction, fool, foolish, foolishness, goal, goals, ignorance, ignorant, journey, lost, map, misdirected, misled, stupid, wander, wandering

quote: If I’m chasing the wrong thing, what I’m chasing will end up chasing me. And in the end, I’m less likely to be the one doing the catching.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: catch, catching, chase, chased, chasing, choice, choices, decisions, desire, desiring, destination, error, flee, fleeing, flight, goal, goals, incorrect, misguided, misled, priorities, priority, pursuing, pursuit, retreat, retreating, wrong

quote: It is the fool who declares ‘I am ascending the summit,’ while he’s toddling around in the ditch.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ascend, ascending, denial, ditch, fool, fooled, foolish, goals, ignorant, lost, misdirected, objectives, stupid, toddling, wander, wandering

quote: Although I regularly convince myself otherwise, because I aim at something doesn’t necessarily mean I have a target.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: aim, aiming, aspirations, bulls-eye, calling, convince, convincing, goals, mission, objectives, target, targeting

quote: Most journeys are armchair calculations strategically charted in some reclined state that are designed to allow us to embark upon a grand journey without ever leaving the armchair. However, real journeys are absent of furniture.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: absent, chart, charted, destination, furniture, goal, goals, journey, laziness, lazy, mediocre, mediocrity, recline, reclined, strategic

quote: The barrier to our future is often the very plans that we’ve created to get there.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: barrier, barriers, create, created, goal, goals, maps, objective, objectives, obstacles, planning, plans, sabotage, self-sabotage, strategize, strategy, tactics, trajectory

quote: There are often two sets of goals in life: those that we establish, and those that really matter.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: authentic, calling, destination, establish, goal, goal-setting, goals, important, matter, mission, priorities, set, valuable, value

quote: The most critical time in any battle is not when I’m fatigued, it’s when I no longer care.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplishments, achievements, attitude, battle, care, critical, defeat, fatigue, fortitude, goals, hopeless, hopelessness, life, success, surrender, tenacity, tired

quote: The presence of a path doesn’t necessarily mean the existence of a destination.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, destination, goal, goals, journey, mission, mistaken, path, road

quote: I thought myself sufficiently shrewd to make whatever decisions I wanted to make, and then to be able to sufficiently steer those decisions away from the rather dark and nasty places they would naturally take me. And I stand oddly perplexed that suddenly everything around me is dark and nasty.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: dark, decisions, desires, direct, ego, egotism, egotistical, foolish, foolishness, goals, nasty, objectives, passions, steer, wisdom

quote: The hallmark of great dreams is not their possibility but their impossibility, and the fact that it is the very notion of the ‘impossible’ that inspires us to go and accomplish them anyway.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: achieve, achievement, aspirations, dreams, goals, hopes, impossible, inspiration, inspire, possibilities, possible

quote: Calm for too long begs the question of whether we're in an all-out pursuit of life, or we're all-out of the pursuit of life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: determination, dreams, goals, god, life, pursuit, vision

quote: To avoid the cost incurred in pursuing great things we opt for ease and blithely abandon great things. The sheer recklessness of such a pathetically apathetic trade-off will eventually cost us a life squandered, which in the end is the greatest cost of all.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, challenges, ease, entitlement, fear, foolishness, goals, god, mediocrity, vision

quote: How often do I stand in abject terror and raw trepidation before the impossible peaks that soar to impossible heights in front me, when God turns to me and calmly says “what mountains?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: barriers, challenges, faith, fear, frightened, goals, god, obstacles, tenacity

quote: Every advancing step I take toward my goal of comfort is yet another retreating step I take away from God's goal of the impossible.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: comfort, fear, goals, god, impossible, mediocrity, passive

quote: A conviction borne of God amply possesses the potency and power to brazenly reach beyond the possible in order to topple the impossible.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: brave, bravery, goals, god, impossible, possible

quote: If I am always standing at the bottom of the mountain longingly looking up, in all probability it is because I have heeded the pillaging dogma of mediocrity which persistently tells me that the dream is not worth the climb.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: challenges, dreams, goals, mediocrity, mountains, sacrifice

quote: I am what no one else is, and in the hands of God I can do what no one else does. And if I dare set such a truth in motion I will change my world.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: goals, god, god-s-will, self-confidence, self-esteem, unique, uniqueness

quote: To find one’s purpose is to discover one’s worth, discern one’s direction, wholly dedicate oneself to the journey, and forge an unbending determination that I will not leave the world the way I found it. This week's blog outlines the finding of our purpose.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: dedication, determination, goals, meaningful-life, purpose

quote: I would surmise that we must cherish the resources that God has given us to achieve a goal more than we cherish the goal itself. For if we fall victim to the pursuit of the goal alone, then the goal has suddenly become our god.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: goal-of-life, goal-priorities, goals, goals-priorities, god-s-plan

quote: Who you are is too vast to be captured by the reflection of a mirror, classified by the state of your attitude, or categorized by the opinions of others. Therefore, if any of these are defining you, you have yet to be defined.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: characteristics, classified, defined, identity, personality, self, self-perception, self-understanding, traits

quote: The thing that I’m most likely to collapse under is not the weight of the stresses that stand around me, but the ego that sits within me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: collapse, ego, egotistical, greed, greedy, heavy, intense, narcissism, narcissistic, self, self-centered, selfish, selfishness, sit, sits, stand, stands, weight

quote: I can confidently state that the greatest rescues in my life have occurred when I’ve been saved from myself.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, arrogant, imprisoned, liberate, liberation, myself, narcissist, narcissistic, prisoner, rescue, rescuing, retrieve, salvation, save, self

quote: If it’s about me, I can be assured that there will be a bunch of empty chairs in the auditorium of my life; save the one I’m sitting in.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: alone, auditorium, chairs, ego, egocentric, empty, greed, greedy, lonely, me, narcissism, narcissistic, self, self-centered, self-centeredness, self-focused, selfish, selfishness

quote: If I can’t quite figure out what an ego is, all I have to do is look for the thing that’s killing itself in the very act of feeding itself.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: destructive, ego, egocentric, feed, feeding, gorge, gorging, greed, greedy, kill, killing, murder, narcissism, narcissistic, self, self-centered, self-destruct, self-destruction, self-mutilation, suicidal, suicide

quote: If it has anything to do with me, it has nothing to do with sacrifice.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ego, egocentric, give, giving, greed, greedy, hoard, hoarding, narcissism, narcissistic, sacrifice, sacrificial, self, selfish, selfishness

quote: If I’m my biggest fan, the only person in the stadium is probably me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: alone, ego, ego-centric, fan, greed, greedy, lonely, narcissism, narcissistic, self, self-centered, self-love, selfish, stadium

quote: Ego is borne of the need to ‘prove’ oneself instead of making the choice to ‘be’ oneself. And so maybe we need to begin curbing the birthrate.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: authentic, authenticity, birth, birthrate, born, borne, choice, choose, curb, curbing, ego, egocentric, egotistical, genuine, genuineness, narcissism, narcissistic, need, prove, self

quote: Whatever the item is that I have chosen to give you, it is nothing more than the receptacle within which I have placed the whole of myself. If it is empty, it is not a gift.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: empty, gift, gifts, giving, meaningless, myself, receptacle, sacrifice, sacrificing, self, self-sacrifice

quote: The death of our self-worth begins at its appraisal, for such an action erroneously implies that our worth can be quantified.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appraisal, death, destroy, kill, self, self-concept, self-confidence, self-esteem, self-image, self-love, self-worth, value, worth

quote: I take my cues from the world around me and carefully paint a self-portrait that the world can’t help but accept. However, I would be much wiser to put down all such artistic notions and hold up the portrait of me painted by God simply because that is a picture at which the world can’t help but marvel.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: artistic, god, portrait, self, self-concept, self-confidence, self-esteem, self-perception, self-understanding

quote: Self-serving biases and self-centered agendas are cotton jammed in the ears of our conscience. Even if truth shouts, we can’t hear it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: agendas, bias, biases, conscience, cotton, deaf, ears, ethics, fortitude, hear, hearing, humble, humility, integrity, morals, self, self-serving, selfish, selfless, selflessness, truth, values

quote: The shortest short-term investment is to serve ourselves.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: greed, greedy, hoard, hoarding, invest, investment, self, self-centered, self-serving, selfish, selfishness, short, shortest, stock-stockpile

quote: If I don’t know who I am apart from everyone else, I probably need to spend some time apart from everyone else.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: conform, conformity, everyone, identity, self, self-awareness, self-concept, self-image, unique, uniqueness

quote: We are always immeasurably bigger than the little person we’ve too often doomed ourselves to be.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bigger, doom, doomed, inferior, inferiority, minimize, person, reduce, sabotage, self, self-concept, self-esteem, underestimate

quote: To save myself I must face myself, which may be the hardest of all things to face.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: face, hard, hardest, honesty, humility, introspection, myself, self, self-evaluation, self-study

quote: To be an end in myself is to bring an end to myself.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: greed, narcissism, self, self-centered, selfish

quote: To be ‘one’ in one’s own hands is to be ‘one.’ To be ‘one’ in the hands of God is to be ‘one’ that is far too vast to be counted.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ability, god, individuality, potential, potential-quotes, self

quote: I think myself so terribly ‘clever’ that the need for God is blatantly irrelevant. And all the while, in the rapidly growing mess that I’m ‘cleverly’ creating, I rather quickly begin to realize that the only thing that is relevant is His relevance.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: god, relationship-with-god, relevance, self, self-centeredness, selfish

quote: If sacrifice is not the theme of my life, there’s no sense telling the story.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, generosity, generous, give, giving, intent, life, meaning, mission, purpose, sacrifice, sacrificing, story, telling, theme, value

quote: To my own demise, I rarely ask why I’m hungry because I’m focusing all of my energies on getting fed. And if I persist in such a diminishing cycle, in all probability I will eventually starve to death because I have chosen to gorge myself on the very things that will keep me empty.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, choices, death, die, greed, hunger, hungry, materialism, meaning, mission, purpose, selfish, starve, superficiality, value

quote: If the baser instinct of rampant self-preservation adamantly refuses to surrender itself to the infinitely greater call of self-sacrifice, in attempting to save our lives we will have in reality completely destroyed our lives.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: call, calling, destroy, generosity, giving, instinct, legacies, legacy, memorial-day, memorials, sacrifice, save, self-preservation, self-sacrifice, selfless, selflessness

quote: To assume that I can even begin to chart a ‘straight’ path is probably the best way I can take myself ‘straight’ to the very place I don’t want to go.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: assume, assumptions, calling, destination, goal, goal-setting, journey, life-goals, mission, path, planning, plans, steps, steps-in-life, strategizing

quote: The reason my life has wandered to nowhere is likely due to the fact that the focus of the moment has dictated the destination of my life, when the destination of my life should have been dictating the focus of the moment.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, destination, dictating, focus, fool, foolish, goal, impulse, impulsive, journey, life, life-journey, lost, meaning, misdirected, mission, moment, proactive, purpose, reactive, role, wisdom, wise

quote: Will I someday pass into history having passed by God and therefore forfeited the opportunity to change my world and reap the blessing of being able to do so because I saw myself as inadequate to achieve either? And how long will it take me to realize that if I doggedly refuse to pass by God, my inadequacy is instantly irrelevant and I have in actuality begun to achieve these very things.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ability, accomplishments, calling, change, confidence, god, inadequacy

quote: Surrender is a choice, it is never a calling.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: apathy, calling, determination, fear, fortitude, laziness, mediocrity, surrender

quote: Timeless principles never age, and truth is as young as the day it was spoken into existence.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: age, created, eternal, ethics, everlasting, existence, fact, god, guidelines, integrity, life, meaning, morals, precepts, principle, principles, standards, substance, timeless, truth, values

quote: If the pursuit of perfection is a way to prove our worth, in the end the pursuit will only prove our imperfections.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: imperfections, perfection, prove, pursuing, pursuit, self-confidence, self-esteem, self-hatred, self-loathing, self-worth, value, worth

quote: In evaluating ourselves, we tend to be long on our weaknesses and short on our strengths.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abilities, bias, disabilities, discernment, evaluation, introspection, introspective, negatives, positives, self-assessment, self-concept, self-esteem, self-evaluation, strengths, weaknesses

quote: Despite our battered exterior and in spite of the festering scars and rank filth that overlays it, there is underneath it all the pristine likeness of God Himself. And we would be wise to cast an eye not on the marred exterior, but to be fixed on the glorious interior.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: beauty, god, image-of-god, inner-beauty, inner-strength, likeness, self-confidence, self-esteem, sin, sinful-nature

quote: It has nothing to do with who I am as compared to everyone else. It has everything to do with who I am in companionship with God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: comparison-to-others, confidence, god, self-concept, self-doubt, self-esteem, self-evaluation, self-perception, value, worth

quote: I say that my value is based on my accomplishments. Christmas is God saying that I am His accomplishment and that will forever be enough.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplishments, christmas, god, self-esteem, value, worth

quote: Whatever the depth of our darkness, God navigated it eons before it was dark. And whatever the duration of our nights, God was there long before it ever turned to night. Therefore, despite our frequent feelings to the contrary, there is no place we might be where God was not lovingly waiting for us an eternity before we got there.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandoned, afraid, alone, assistance, assurance, comfort, companion, confidence, darkness, eternity, feelings, frightened, god, help, known, lonely, lovingly, night, rescue, salvation, saved, waiting

quote: With God, being lost is nothing more than an idea that never has and never will be anything more than an idea.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandon, abandoned, assured, beliefs, confidence, faith, god, idea, ideas, longing, lost, misbeliefs, misguided, misled, search, searching, wander, wandering

quote: The challenge is never based on the size of the obstacle that stands before me. Rather, it is dictated by the degree of faith that rests within me.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplishment, barriers, challenge, challenges, confidence, confident, defeat, difficulties, faith, faithless, fearful, giants, god, insecure, insecurity, me, myself, obstacles, setbacks, struggles, trials, victories, victory

quote: Failure is not the deterrent for the next try. Rather, it is information that empowers the next step.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: adverse, attempt, barrier, barriers, deter, deterrent, empower, empowering, fail, failing, failure, impedance, impede, information, insight, obstacle, step, steps, try

quote: Failure is a friend if we can see past the face of the foe that we project on it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: express, face, facial, facial-expression, fail, failure, foe, friend, project, projecting, projection

quote: Failure is blessing wrapped in the clothing of curse.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bless, blessing, clothe, clothing, curse, cursed, cursing, deceit, deception, dress, dressing, fail, failed, failure, wrap, wrapped

quote: The fear of getting knocked down is less about the pain of the fall and more about the embarrassment in having fallen. And so, to rid myself of the latter is to reduce my concern about the former, which means I just unleashed my life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: consequence, consequences, embarrassed, embarrassment, fail, failed, failure, fall, fallen, free, freed, knocked-down, liberated, liberation, mistaken, repercussion, repercussions, unleash, unleashed

quote: If I’m conceited enough to believe I’m invincible, then maybe it will take me doing the very thing I swore I would never do to understand that I’m not as wonderful as I thought I was.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bold, boldness, committed, conceit, conceited, disappoint, disappointed, ego, egocentric, fail, failure, narcissist, narcissistic, self-centered, swore, wonderful

quote: The real promise in too many promises is a promise that I’m going to be disappointed.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandon, abandoned, betrayal, betrayed, commit, commitment, deceit, deceiving, deception, disappoint, disappointed, fail, failure, integrity, let-down, lie, lies, lying, oath, pledge, promise, promises, promising

quote: The reason placing blame repeatedly fails to work is that I repeatedly place it on everyone else instead of where it actually belongs.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accountability, accountable, avoid, avoidance, blame, blame-placing, blaming, excuses, fail, failure, integrity, irresponsible, justification, justify, rationalization, rationalize, responsibility, responsible

quote: Most of my failures can be ascribed to the fact that I chose that which was ‘easy’ over that which was ‘right’. And while it’s ‘right’ to admit this to myself, it isn’t ‘easy.’ So, which choice am I going to make this time?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: acknowledge, admit, choice, choices, choosing, chose, correct, decide, deciding, decisions, easier, easy, ethical, fail, failed, failure, fool, foolish, moral, right, wisdom, wise

quote: Sometimes we are so caught up in the disappointment of plans gone astray that we fail to recognize the potentially new options that might now exist.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: failure

quote: In my impatience I become convinced that this desire of mine should have been fulfilled yesterday, when it belongs to a tomorrow that yesterday would have killed had I had my way.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: desire, destroy, destroyed, gratification, greed, greedy, immediate-gratification, impatience, impatient, kill, killed, patience, patient, self-destruction, self-sabotage, selfish, selfishness, tomorrow, want, yesterday

quote: If those who cause destruction have come to be ‘newsworthy’, and those who heal the devastation of that destruction have come to be less than ‘noteworthy’, has our thirst to be entertained become the truly destructive thing?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: addiction, adrenaline-rush, backwards, desire, destroy, destruction, devastation, entertained, entertainment, heal, help, hero-s, media, news, news-media, newsworthy, noteworthy, publicize, publish, radio, restore, social-media, television, thirst, twisted

quote: I am so often the architect of my own pain and the engineer of my own failures.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: personal-growth

quote: Why is it that we don’t worry about a compass until we’re lost in a wilderness of our own making?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: advice, compass, concern, course, direction, guidance, lost, self-destruction, self-sabotage, wilderness, wisdom, worry

quote: God is able to fix that which is broken so that what stands repaired is immeasurably greater than that which stood before it needed repair. Therefore, the most staggering brokenness conceivable is in reality the greatest opportunity imaginable.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: broken, brokenness, fix, god, heal, healing, opportunity, repair, repaired, restoration, restore, transform, transforming

quote: Contradictions are the impossible chasms that create forever separations. God is the forever bridge that creates impossible reunions.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bridge, chasms, contradictions, division, forever, god, heal, healing, impossible, join, reconcile, reconciliation, reunions, reunite, separation, separations, unite

quote: The dark might be dark, but at least we don’t have to look at ourselves when we’re standing in it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accountability, accountable, ashamed, dark, darkness, denial, escape, escaping, flee, fleeing, hide, hiding, honest, honesty, integrity, responsibility, responsible, retreat, retreating, self-evaluation, shame, stand, standing, withdraw, withdrawal

quote: If I had a single wish, I would wish sixty seconds of total depravity upon myself. For one of the greatest gifts of all is to have ‘nothing’ so that I can finally learn how to appreciate ‘everything’.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciate, appreciation, depravity, impoverish, impoverished, perspective, poverty, thankful, thankfulness, thanks, thanksgiving, wish, wishful, wishing

quote: Greed is the fast-track to poverty.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bankrupt, bankruptcy, egocentric, greed, greedy, impoverished, poverty, self-centered, selfish, selfishness

quote: To be blessed and yet permit gluttony to blind me to the blessings is to banish myself to a life of unrelenting poverty even though I might be utterly engulfed in the embrace of a million marvelous blessings.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abundance, blind, blindness, gluttony, greed, poverty, selfish, selfishness

quote: True evil is unlikely to receive an invitation from us, so it clothes itself in just enough truth to make itself look appealing and then it looks to unpeel us.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appealing, clothes, clothing, cunning, deceit, deception, deceptive, distortions, evil, invitation, lie, lying, true, truth, unpeel

quote: My rather arrogant attitude deludes me into believing that my ability to understand something is the criteria for its legitimacy. And if there’s one thing in my life that I don’t understand yet I allow to be legitimate, thinking this way would most certainly be it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, confining, confused, deluded, ego-centric, fool, legitimate, limited, prideful, understanding

quote: If we limit love to being nothing more than a feeling, we have no real feeling for what love is.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: feeling, feelings, interpretation, limit, limitations, love, loved, understanding

quote: Only God understands how incredibly far we’ve fallen, and only God understands how incredibly far we can rise. And only we can determine if we’re going to wallow in the mediocrity that is born of the refusal to understand either.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplish, achieve, fall, fallen, far, god, incredible, mediocre, mediocrity, opportunities, opportunity, passive, passivity, possibilities, possibility, potential, rise, understand, understanding, wallow

quote: The greatest gains that we will ever experience arise from the greatest sacrifices that we have ever known.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accomplishments, achievements, arise, caring, experience, gains, giving, priorities, sacrifice, sacrifices, successes

quote: To enjoy beauty in the company of myself is to experience beauty bound by the limits of the sole person that I am. But, to experience beauty in the company of God is to experience beauty bound by the limits of Who God is, which is to experience beauty without limits.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: beauty, experience, god, life-experiences, limitations, limits

quote: We might do well to take a look at what we’ve crammed into our pockets as it will say much about what we’ve crammed into our hearts.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: focus, hearts, importance, introspection, introspective, observe, pockets, priorities, priority, self-aware, self-awareness, self-evaluation, self-study, value

quote: Has it not ‘dawned’ on us that many of the things that we incessantly blame others for are actually things that our actions originally set in motion? Or, are we too weak to experience a ‘dawning’ of that sort?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: anger, blame, choices, consequences, justification, rationalization, repercussions, responsible

quote: Oh yes, I am frequently driven to an enraged frenzy by the blatantly crass actions of others. But to be painfully honest, that anger is much less driven by the reality of their actions and far more fueled by the realization that everything I am is everything that I hate in them.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: anger, blame, frankness, honesty, introspective, justification, self-evaluation, self-honesty

quote: Real, lasting closure is never secured through retribution or retaliation.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: anger

quote: Love that is fueled solely by feelings will suddenly find itself out of gas on a long road with no gas stations.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: emotions, feelings, fueled, gas, love, loved, road, shallow, station, superficial

quote: It’s thinking that I had the solution that probably created the problem in the first place.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: correct, create-created, ego, ego-centric, egotistical, fool, fooled, foolish, misguided, misinformed, narcissism, narcissistic, problem, problems, self-destructive, self-sabotage, solution, solutions, solve, stupid, stupidity, think, thinking

quote: Ignorance is not bliss. Rather, ignorance is blistering.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bliss, blistering, consequence, discerning, discernment, ignorance, ignore, karma, payback, repercussion, repercussions, stupidity, think, thinking, thoughtful, wisdom

quote: To love those who hate us is to refuse to borrow their hatred.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: borrow, hate, hatred, love, retribution, revenge

quote: Hate feeds on itself, while love will always find itself fed.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: fed, feed, feeding, hate, hatred, love, loved, nurtured

quote: The love hidden within is always greater than the hate displayed without.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: hate, love, loving-people, valentine-s-day

quote: It might not be about perfection. Rather, it may be that that which is imperfect is that which has the most character.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: attributes, character, characteristics, fallible, human, imperfect, imperfection, perfect, perfection, personality, qualities, traits, uniqueness

quote: If God created great things with a point of vulnerability, it would lie in the reality that great things die in the hands of great ignorance.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: carelessness, god, great, greatness, ignorance, vulnerability

quote: I want to stand on the belief that great things are the product of ordinary people who are made great when they stand.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: commitment, convictions, greatness, taking-a-stand, tenacity

quote: Truth speaks for itself if we’d just let it speak.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: distortions, fact, heard, hearing, honest, honesty, lies, listen, listening, lying, mislead, speak, truth, truthful, voice

quote: Such is the power of truth that even the slightest whisper of it can handily drown out the most boisterous of lies, which may explain why in many instances God only needs to whisper.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: authentic, boisterous, drown, explain, explanation, genuine, god, honest, honesty, lies, lying, real, slight, slightest, solid, truth, truthful, whisper

quote: There appears to be value in getting past a mentality that good things can only rest in good things.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: positive-thoughts

quote: To recklessly excuse a failure is to believe that I’ve effectively erased it from the story of my life, when I’ve actually imprinted it in indelible ink.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: deceive, deceived, denial, deny, excuse, excuses, ignorance, ignore, immovable, indelible, ink, justification, justify, life, permanence, permanent, rationalization, rationalize, story, story-of-life

quote: We somehow have led ourselves to believe that our questions are big enough to encircle life, and that life is small enough to be contained by the answers. The real question might be, are we ignorant or just plain stupid?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: answer, answers, arrogance, arrogant, bold, ego, egocentric, egotistical, ignorance, ignorant, life, misled, naive, naiveté, narcissism, narcissistic, question, questions, stupid, stupidity

quote: In a very tragic kind of way, sometimes things have to be gone before I fully realize that they were ever there.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciate, appreciation, assume, assumptions, blind, blinded, careless, carelessness, cherish, cherishing, gone, granted, hold-dear, ignorance, ignore, lose, lost, take-for-granted, tragedy, tragic, valuable, value

quote: Maybe it’s a whole lot less about focusing on the fact that we’re all victims and a whole lot more about the changing the fact that we’re all careless, as that is what victimized all of us in the first place.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandon, abandoned, abused, betray, betrayed, callous, callousness, careless, carelessness, cold, cruel, cruelty, focus, focusing, hurt, ignorance, ignorant, insensitive, neglect, neglected, perpetrator, thoughtless, victim, victimization, victimized, victims

quote: To label myself is similar to thinking that I can come up with a single phrase to explain the universe.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: categorize, describe, description, explain, explanation, ignorance, ignorant, label, labels, minimize, phrase, reduce, reduction, self-description, stupid, stupidity, universe

quote: At the very point that I’ve taken something for granted, I have at that same moment taken it to its grave. And if I look around, I realize I’ve cultivated quite a cemetery.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciate, appreciation, buried, bury, careless, cemetery, entitled, entitlement, foolish, granted, grave, ignorance, kill, killed, rights, selfish, terminate, terminated, value

quote: To assume that I and I alone have all the answers is to eventually find myself entirely alone without any answers.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: alone, answers, arrogance, arrogant, assume, cures, ignorance, ignorant, misdirected, misguided, misinformed, pride, prideful, self-absorbed, selfish, solutions

quote: When wisdom gives way to whimsy and ethics fall to excitement, it is highly likely that the ground beneath me will ‘give way’ and it is I who will ‘fall.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: discerning, ethics, fall, fool, foolish, ignorance, ignorant, impulsive, judgement, morals, stupidity, whimsy, wisdom, wise

quote: Truth is its own defense, therefore if something can’t speak for itself, it’s not truth.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: defend, defense, distortions, eternal, ethics, fabrication, fact, firm, honest, independent, lies, morals, principle, standard, truth, unwavering, values

quote: If I assume the ‘truth’ to be negotiable based on whether or not it serves my agenda, then my agenda has become my ‘truth.’ And the ‘truth’ of the matter is, when I do this I’ve chosen to take a treacherous path through some very deep woods where neither path nor woods exist.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: agenda, distortion, egocentrism, egoism, fact, lies, negotiate-compromise, selfish, truth

quote: I simply can’t look into the heavens on a crisp starry night and somehow bring myself to believe that the gaping expanse that engulfs the whole of me is the product of chance happenstance. And neither can I believe that the gaping expanse that rests within me is anything less.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: chance, created, creation, design, evolution, god, happenstance, intelligent-design, intent, myself, purpose, universe

quote: If you think you can stand to know what you’re made of, try kneeling before God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: god, identity, kneeling, made, made-of, personhood, self-analysis, self-discovery, stand, standing, submission, transparency, vulnerability, vulnerable

quote: Everything I touch makes me a little bit more like the thing I’m touching, so I’d better start paying attention to what I’m touching.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: attention, engage, identity, identity-crisis, interact, invest, investment, priorities, priority, reflection, self-identity, self-image, touch

quote: Love is a perpetual journey that is extraordinary because it will never find itself terminated by a destination.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ceaseless, destination, endless, exceptional, extraordinary, forever, journey, love, loved, loving, stop, terminate, terminated

quote: All along, I was less concerned about walking a path of integrity and more caught up in a compass calibrated by greed. And with a compass such as this, how is it that I’m having a hard time understanding why I am where I am?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: agendas, choices, compass, confusion, consequences, direction, greed, guilt, integrity, journey, life, natural-consequences, outcomes, path, priorities, regret, results

quote: The step that we are on is only a step to the next place, and no step regardless of how massive is ever a destination.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: destination, journey, limbo, momentum, process, progression, stall, step, stepping, stop

quote: We can only climb the mountains because there’s a valley that makes the mountain a mountain.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ascent, challenges, climb, climbing, determination, determined, forceful, journey, life, mountain, mountains, path, road, valley, valleys

quote: We can only get to God through God. Every other possible avenue is a dead-end before it even starts.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: avenue, course, dead-end, god, journey, map, path, reclaimed, redeem, redeemed, restore, restored, salvation, saved, through

quote: It is inevitable that I will leave a legacy simply because I cannot walk through life without leaving footprints as I walk. Therefore, I would be wise to consider the path before I make the prints.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: careful, footprints, journey, legacy, life-journey, memorials, path, thoughtful, thoughtfulness, wisdom, wise

quote: Happenstance is the myth of the simple mind, for it is the deliberate genius of God that what appears entirely disjointed always reveals itself to be stunningly seamless. And it is in reflecting on such stunning ingenuity that our faith becomes seamless.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: chaos, circumstance, circumstances, faith, genius, god, ingenuity, journey, life, stunning

quote: Nearly everyday life leans over and says, ‘Come on down!’ But standing at the bottom looking up, it’s finally dawned on me that it’s not these invitations that have dug this hole. Rather, it’s the fact that I accepted them.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accept, agree, agreement, bottom, choice, choices, choose, choosing, create, created, decisions, dig, dug, follow, following, fool, foolish, foolishness, gullibility, gullible, hole, holes, invitation, invitations, life, pit, realization, realize, rock-bottom, wisdom, wise

quote: If I have refused to risk, I have in the self-same decision refused to love. And if indeed I have refused to love, tragically I have refused to live. And when will I realize that that in and of itself is an unacceptable risk.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: choices, decision, decisions, diminished, diminishment, life, love, lover, loving, refusal, refused, risk, risk-taker, risking, tragic, tragically, unacceptable

quote: My life is a series of invitations accepted and invitations rejected, and the place I now find myself is often a result of accepting the wrong invitations and rejecting the right ones.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accepted, choice, choices, choosing, consequence, consequences, discernment, fallout, invitations, invite, natural-consequences, outcome, rejected, result, results, wisdom

quote: More times than I can remember I look around and I ask why the hole I’m in looks so strangely familiar. Probably because it looks a whole lot like all the other ones I dug before I got around to digging this one.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: choice, choices, dig, dug, familiar, familiarity, hole, holes, pit, problem, repetition, sabotage, self-sabotage, situation, stupid, stupidity, wisdom

quote: To make a choice not to sacrifice is to decide that I am better off allowing a life to perish than release the resources I possess that might allow it to thrive. And because of choices such as these, the life that I am really allowing to perish is mine.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: caring, choice, choices, choosing, consequences, give, giving, greed, life, perish, perishing, release, resources, sacrifice, sacrificial, sacrificing, self-centered

quote: More times than I’m willing to admit I am my own worst enemy, which suggests that more times than I’m willing to admit I should allow God to be my own best friend.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: acknowledge, admit, best-friend, choices, confess, decisions, discernment, enemy, fool, foolish, friend, god, sabotage, self-destructive

quote: We got where we are because our choices mapped the route and paved the road.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: choice, choices, consequence, consequences, decisions, map, mapped, outcomes, pave, paved, planning, plans, repercussion, repercussions, result, road, route

quote: We want to 'write in' our plan and 'write out' the consequence. When we do that, we're headed 'right back' to what we foolishly thought we could 'write out.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: avoid, avoidance, choices, consequence, consequences, eliminate, erase, fool, foolish, foolishly, plan, planning, script, strategist, strategy

quote: I will either adamantly prioritize my agendas at the expense of the truth, or I will consistently bring my agendas into unrelenting obedience to the truth. And if for some reason you’re trying to determine who I truly am, the choice I make will tell you.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accountability, agendas, authenticity, choice, choices, courageous, integrity, obedience, priorities, prioritize-quotes, strong, truth

quote: It would be advisable to realize that we will eventually become whatever it is that we’ve created. And too often what we’ve created is a massive mess.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: choices, choices-and-consequences, consequences, life, life-lessons

quote: Many of our efforts to intentionally craft and subsequently force our limited vision on life has more often than not resulted in some degree of cataclysm or schism or division or any number of other things that aren’t all that savory.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: choices, consequences, decisions, regrets, regretting

quote: Everything that I hold will eventually be gone. Subsequently, the quality of my life will depend on whether I choose to appreciate those things ‘now’ or wait until ‘then.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciate, appreciation, fleeting, fool, foolish, life, materialism, quality-of-life, temporal, temporary, thankful, thankfulness, thanksgiving, value, wait, waiting, wisdom, wise

quote: Starting over begins when I develop a reawakened appreciation for what I already have, a renewed recognition of what I’ve recklessly forsaken, a rehabilitated understanding that I foolishly do both of those things, and a revitalized commitment to live the rest of my life never doing either of them again.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciate, appreciation, awaken, begin, begin-again, beginning, care, caution, cherish, discernment, discretion, foolish, foolishness, forsake, forsaken, reawaken, recognition, restart, savor, squander, start, thankful, thankfulness, value, wisdom

quote: Anything great will only be appreciated if I am given the opportunity to feel the absence of it, or experience the reversal of it. It is only then that I can even begin to understand its majesty and cherish it in the manner I should have all along.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: absence, appreciate, appreciated, cheapen, cherish, diminish, esteem, regard, regret, regretful, reversal, sacred, shame, value

quote: Judging others is too often escapism dressed in the garb of righteous indignation, whereby I dutifully point out in others that which I probably should be pointing out in myself.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: condemn, condemnation, critical, escapism, judge, judgement, judgmental, justice, self-assessment, self-examination

quote: If we are merely a chance product of ‘random happenstance’ and nothing more, doesn’t it strike you as a bit odd that we have the ability to contemplate the question of ‘random happenstance’ with such methodical complexity?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: chance, complex, complexity, contemplate, contradictory, creation, creationism, evolution, evolutionary, god, happenstance, illogical, methodical, odd, opposed, opposite, random, randomness

quote: Making oneself large involves intentionally making oneself small.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: give, giving, humble, humility, large, pride, sacrifice, sacrificial, selfless, selflessness, serve, service, servitude, small

quote: The point that I think myself to be so terribly clever is the precise point at which I am beginning to think myself to be god-like, which causes me to become God-less.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, arrogant, clever, egocentric, egoism, egotistical, god, god-like, godless, humble, humility, idol, idolatry, smart, superior, worship

quote: If I continually focus on what I don’t have, my life will always be completely empty despite the fact that it’s completely full.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciate, appreciation, attitude, empty, entitlement, focus, full, grateful, optimist, orientation, owed, perspective, perspectives, pessimist, point-of-view, poor, rich, thankful, thanks, thanksgiving

quote: Thankfulness is an attitude of possibilities, not an attitude of liabilities.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciation, attitude, faith, liabilities, life-view, optimism, optimistic, perspective, pessimism, pessimistic, point-of-view, possibilities, thankful, thankfulness, thanks, thanksgiving

quote: Because thankfulness is the tonic that always cures the cancers of greed, envy and jealously, it should be taken in liberal doses daily.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciation, attitude, cure, envy, greed, jealousy, lifestyle, mindset, perspective, resentment, solution, thankful, thankfulness, thanks, thanksgiving, tonic

quote: I can only see life as this most miserable accident that I have been forced to endure simply because I refuse to see it as the most astounding plan that I have been privileged to engage.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accident, appreciate, appreciation, astounding, gratitude, life, miserable, opportunity, plan, privilege, thankful, thanks, thanksgiving

quote: We tend to perseverate on the fact that as far as we might have fallen, there’s always another bottom underneath the one we’re laying on. Yet, for every bottom underneath us, there’s always endless opportunity above us.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bottom, fall, fallen, falling, opportunity, optimism, optimistic, pessimism, pessimistic, possibility, underneath

quote: Romanticizing comes with colored glasses of the most colored sort.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bias, colored-glasses, distortion, perspective, point-of-view, romantic, romanticizing, skew

quote: We really can’t afford to live our lives walking in some sort of introspective darkness as if the darkness is the only thing that we can walk in.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: self-realization

quote: Although I’m seldom aware enough to see it, the greater cost regarding that which I possess was not what I paid for it, but what someone along the way sacrificed so that I might have the opportunity to pay for it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: aware, awareness, cost, gift, giving, opportunity, paid, payment, possess, possessing, possession, price, sacrifice, sacrificial, sacrificing, selfless, selflessness

quote: Until I realize that it’s all I gift, I can hold all of it and yet receive none of it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: acknowledge, appreciate, aware, awareness, empty, gift, hold, hollow, opportunities, opportunity, privilege, privileges, realize-realization, receive, thankful, thankfulness, thanksgiving

quote: Heaven shows up all the time. But we plan our time so that we show up in other places.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrives, destination, encounter, engage, heaven, intersect, join, location, plan, present, reveal, revealed, see, time

quote: Sometimes the grandest of all events are described in the poverty of a few simple words.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: communication

quote: When I read the ghastly lines of tragedy darkly penned into my life, I turn and notice that the pen in my hand is wet.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: chronicle, create, created, dark, destructive, forboding, ghastly, hand, life, life-story, pen, sabotage, self-destructive, self-fulfilling, self-fulfilling-prophecy, self-sabotage, story, tragedy, tragic, write, writing

quote: Each day hands me a clean sheet of paper upon which to write. Therefore, I would be wise to write without ever having the need to erase.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: acumen, author, authorship, careless, carelessness, caution, discernment, erase, error, errors, insight, life-story, map, mistakes, paper, plan, planning, story, wisdom, write, writing

quote: We have the power of the pen to write the next chapter, and the privilege to author the page in whatever fashion we choose. Yet, seldom do we understand the power of the pen and the privilege of the page.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: author, authorship, chapter, chapters, create, journal, life-story, lives, page, pen, privilege, story

quote: Arrogance is a map of a road that leads to bridges that are out.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, arrogant, bridge, bridges, ego, egotism, map, maps, pride, road, roads, self-destructive, self-determination

quote: At the point that it dawns on me that I am not God I have finally made room for God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, arrogant, egotism, egotistical, god, idols, pride, prideful, room, salvation, self-absorbed, self-centered, selfish, surrender

quote: To declare myself as a genius immediately evidences that I am not.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, arrogant, ego, egocentric, egocentrism, foolish, foolishness, genius, narcissism, narcissistic, narcissists, pride, prideful

quote: Authorship of anything apart from God is nothing more than a tragedy in the making.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: arrogance, arrogant, author, authorship, ego, egocentric, god, independence, tragedy, tragic

quote: Simply giving something ‘a shot’ is not giving something our ‘best,’ for our best is made up of as many ‘shots’ as it takes in order to be our best.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: best, best-effort, chance, determination, determined, effort, excellence, force, intentional, opportunity, persistence, persistent, press, purposeful, push, shot, tenacious, tenacity

quote: The true sign of a robust and mature life rests in how many times that life has been knocked down, for to be incessantly knocked down and yet find oneself still standing means that someone had the resolve to get up that many times plus one.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: defeat, determination, fortitude, perserverance, success, tenacity

quote: It’s not about some principled debate as to whether I should focus on what I have, or on what I don’t have. Rather, it’s about being thankful that I have the privilege to enjoy the former, and the opportunity to contemplate the latter.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: appreciation, debate, debating, opportunity, possessions, possibilities, privilege, thankful, thankfulness, thanksgiving

quote: It might behoove us to realize that isolation is the absence of all the senseless clutter, and all the incessant racket that would keep God from having ample room to show up and sufficient silence to be heard. Therefore, isolation may actually be the place where we are least isolated.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ascertain, clutter, discern, distractions, god, hear, heard, hearing, isolated, isolation, noise, obstructions, opportunity, racket, room, space

quote: We want a fresh start only because we didn’t sufficiently care for the last fresh start.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: begin, beginning, care, caring, fresh, fresh-start, maintain, maintenance, mulligan, new, opportunity, repeat, responsibility, responsible, start, sufficient, sufficiently

quote: Death reminds us that life is a temporary privilege, not an endless right.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: death, dying, entitled, entitlement, gift, opportunity, privilege, right, temporal, temporary

quote: To focus solely on endings is to trade conclusions for the very beginnings that created them. And if this cycle should persist, we will likewise miss the beginning that will follow this ending.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: begin, beginnings, conclusions, cycle, cycle-of-life, end, endings, fresh, mulligan, new, opportunity, restart, second-chances, start, trade

quote: We’re constantly presented with opportunity, or the opportunity to create opportunity.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: opportunity

quote: Opportunity is present is wreckage as much as it is in that which is wonderful. It’s not so much how it comes to us, but what we do with it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: opportunity

quote: While real sacrifice is committed to the result, it relishes the effort
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: effort, gift, giving, goal, sacrifice, sacrificial, selfless, share

quote: I have diligently disciplined my life to search out life’s gifts in the very places where society mistakenly says life stores its scraps. And I am constantly amazed that in the treasure trove that surrounds me, I stand in the company of so few.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: authentic, deceived, deception, disciplined, fooled, genuine, gift, gifts, hidden, life, misdirected, misguided, mistaken, scraps, treasure, treasures

quote: We have errantly romanticized love as something we freely get verses something we sacrifice for in the giving.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: confused, confusion, freely, gift, give, giving, love, loving, sacrifice, sacrificial

quote: To simply survive appears to be the choice of the plodding hoards that wander all around me. Therefore, I’ve adamantly committed to never hoard hoards.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandon, abandonment, conform, conformity, exist, existence, hoard, hoards, mediocre, mediocrity, passive, surrender, surrendering, survival, survive, vision, visionless

quote: Too many of us view liberty as something that ‘just is,’ and too few see it as something that ‘is’ only because someone, somewhere was faced with the formidable reality that to keep liberty meant paying a stiff price.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: liberty

quote: The greatest abuse that we perpetrate on liberty is our assumed right to it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: liberty

quote: It is the restraint of patience that yields the magnificent in life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: instant-gratification, magnificence, magnificent, patience, patient, restraint, yields

quote: Oftentimes I think it is far better to listen for an answer, rather than talk out of an effort to create one.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: acumen, answer, answers, better, create, direction, fabricate, observe, observer, observing, patience, patient, problem-solve, problem-solving, strategize, talk, watch

quote: To wait is to wisely resign myself to the fact that my ‘timetable’ is too often a ‘table’ with two legs that won’t stand up no matter how much ‘time’ I give it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: give-up, impatience, impatient, patience, patient, plans, resign, strategies, surrender, time, timetable, wait, waiting

quote: Where am I?” you ask. Where you are is where the things you’ve denied worshipping have taken you.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: confuse, confused, denial, deny, disorient, disoriented, gods, idol, idols, lost, misguided, misled, priorities, priority, worship, worshipping

quote: The ‘gods’ that do us the greatest harm are the gods we deny having.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: altar, bow, bow-down, danger, dangerous, denial, deny, follow, god, gods, harm, harmful, ignorant, ignore, justification, justify, misdirected, misguided, obey, prioritize, priority, risk, risky, surrender, worship

quote: A goal lacking a sense of ethics is a goal that lacks any sense.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: common-sense, ethics, goal, morals, principles, sense, valid, validity, values

quote: How many times has our conscience firmly prompted us to ‘draw the line,’ and we showed up with an eraser?
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: conscience, denial, eraser, ethics, foolish, foolishness, justification, morals, rationalization, refusal, refuse, right, self-control, stubborn, values, wisdom, wise, wrong

quote: If we dare examine our decisions, we will see our values woven in and through every single one of them. Therefore, it would do us well to take an occasional peek to insure that our values remain at their peak.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: decisions, ethics, integrity, morals, peak, peek, principles, value-system, values

quote: It is, I think, a far lesser offense to blatantly ignore God’s directions for our lives rather than arrogantly think ourselves shrewd enough to be able to bend them to our liking without breaking them and therefore breaking ourselves.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ethics, god, god-s-will, manipulation, morals, obedience, selfishness, values

quote: Despite opinions to the contrary, restoring Godly values is the most progressive course of action that we could ever hope to take.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: values

quote: I spend my life constantly calling in ‘imaginary’ debts that aren’t owed to me in order to avoid the ‘real’ debts that I owe to others, and so everybody ends up bankrupt.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: bankrupt, bankruptcy, blind, blindness, debt, demand, demanding, denial, ego, egocentric, entitlement, imaginary, imagine, narcissism, narcissistic, owe, owed, real, selfish, selfishness

quote: Sacrifice” and “self” both begin with the same letter, but the spelling is way different after that.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: contrast, contrasts, differences, different, ego, egocentric, generosity, generous, give, giving, narcissism, narcissistic, opposites, sacrifice, sacrificial, selfish, selfishness, spell, spelling

quote: I pretend to give gifts that people pretend to be gifts so that I can pretend that I gave something that actually cost me something. And what pretending of this sort gives me is the gift of a pretend life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: deceit, deceive, deception, ego, egocentric, fake, false, fraudulence, fraudulent, gifts, give, giving, greed, greedy, lie, life, narcissism, narcissistic, pretend, pretending, self-centered, selfish, selfishness

quote: An obese ego is just about the heaviest thing you’ll ever carry. So maybe you should stop feeding it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: burden, burdened, ego, egocentric, egotistical, fatigued, feed, feeding, gorging, heaviest, heavy, narcissism, narcissistic, obese, self-serving, selfish, selfishness, tired, weight, weighty

quote: You can dress up greed, but you can’t stop the stench.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: disguise, ego, egocentric, fake, fraud, fraudulent, greed, greedy, justification, justify, narcissist, narcissistic, odor, odors, rationalize, self-centered, selfish, selfishness, smell, stench, stink, stinky

quote: Love in the service of self is greed in disguise.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: deceit, deceitful, deception, disguise, ego, egocentric, greed, greedy, love, loving, narcissistic, self-centered, selfish, selfishness

quote: The burdens I carry on my back are in direct correlation to the weight of my ego.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: burdens, ego, egocentric, guilt, remorse, repentence, selfish, weight

quote: The image of God infused in us never sees the light of day in the service of self, but it becomes the light of day in the service of others.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: giving, image-of-god, sacrifice, self-centeredness, selfishness, service

quote: Often we don’t see the majesty of God’s design because we’re caught up in the mediocrity of our own designs.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: blind, blinded, design, god, majestic, majesty, mediocre, mediocrity, myopic, perception, shortsighted, shortsightedness, vision

quote: The problem that I think I have with God is often not a problem at all. Rather, it is most frequently a tired misperception where I have made God what I need Him to be in order to justify my rejection of Him.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandon, abandonment, agenda, god, justification, justify, manipulate, manipulation, misperception, perception, reject, rejection

quote: As utterly irrational as it might seem, the greed within me has the most limited vision I can possibly imagine as it has eyes only for the few things it doesn’t have, and it is completely blind to all the many remarkable things that it does.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: blind, blindness, desires, eyesight, flawed, greed, greedy, inaccurate, irrational, needs, possessions, privilege, rational, selfish, selfishness, skewed, vision, wants

quote: Faith revels in the liberating fact that only a terribly miniscule part of life lies within the constricted confines of my reach, and that I am graciously invited out to live in a place beyond my grasp.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: faith, faithless, god, hope, impossible, infinite, mediocrity, vision

quote: The only things I truly keep are those things that I give away.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: give, giving, greed, greedy, hold, keep, preserve, retain, sacrifice, sacrificial, share, sharing

quote: If I’m asking what kind of ‘return’ I should be expecting on the sacrifices I’m making, I have in that question revealed the need to ‘return’ that question to wherever I found it and have the word ‘return’ edited out of it.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: dividend, edit, editing, egocentric, giving, greed, misconstrue, misunderstand, misunderstood, narcissism, narcissistic, question, return, sacrifice, sacrifices, sacrificial, sacrificing, self-serving, selfish, selfishness, selfless, wisdom, word, wording

quote: If I am not touching a life, I am not touching life.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: assistance, assisting, companion, companionship, generosity, gifts, give, giving, help, helping, interact, interacting, life, partnership, sacrifice, sacrificing, touch, touching

quote: To calculate sacrifice is to attempt to sacrifice safely, and safe sacrifice is one of the most outrageous oxymoron’s I can think of.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calculate, generosity, generous, give, giver, giving, sacrifice, sacrificial, safe, safety

quote: Contrary to popular opinion, we are all a vast brotherhood of human beings whose very survival hinges not on what we keep, but on what we give. And it is in the giving that we not only survive to live another day, but we thrive to celebrate another day.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: charity, giving, gratuity, greed, humanity, sacrifice, selfishness, selflessness

quote: To fill the fathomless caverns of my thirsty soul I must work entirely contrary to impulses of my own humanity, for it is in emptying myself at the very point where I am most empty that I fill myself.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: fulfillment, giving, sacrifice, sacrificing, satisfaction

quote: If I give with the motive to get, regardless of the degree to which that motive besets me, I will walk away impoverished and I will leave those to whom I have given just as impoverished as I have now found myself.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: giving, godly-values, impoverished-thought, motives, sacrifice, selfishness

quote: I cannot calculate nor attempt to manage sacrifice, for to do so is to attempt to sacrifice comfortably. And it is in the attempt to sacrifice comfortably that I begin to realize that the desire for comfort is in reality the demand that I put myself first, and there is nothing of sacrifice in that.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: comfort, comfortable, giving, godly-gratitude, greed, sacrifice, selfishness

quote: I am thankful that in the giving we receive, and what we receive is the satisfaction of knowing that whatever we give is always bigger once we’ve given it away.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: give, giving, love, loving-others, sacrifice, sacrificial-mentality

quote: Love knows nothing of short hauls because it has committed itself for the long haul.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: love, loving, loving-others, sacrifice, valentine-s-day

quote: Real accomplishments do virtually nothing to serve me and they do everything to serve others. Anything less is nothing more than a meaningless task dressed in the deceptive finery of accomplishments.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: sacrifice

quote: I am thankful that to be attuned to the needs of another attunes us to the world, and that if I stay attuned only to my needs I will always be a stranger to the world.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: love, love-others, sacrifice, sacrifices

quote: I am thankful that sacrifice is non-negotiable, and that counting the cost in giving to another is foolishly assuming that we can put a price on sacrifice.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: giving-to-others, love, loving-one-another, loving-others, sacrifice

quote: To put others in front of ourselves is to put God in front of everything.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: sacrifice

quote: Good tells us that our agenda is the agenda of the person next to us.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: sacrifice

quote: There’s something tightly woven throughout the fabric of our humanity that runs entirely opposite to the baser instinct of looking out for our own good.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: sacrifice

quote: The service of self terminates at our own death.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: sacrifice

quote: Being our best involves walking away from every situation with less than what we had when we encountered it because we left something behind in the exchange.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: sacrifice

quote: Yet, there is a sense of some deep sort that runs entirely contrary to human nature, that in putting ourselves first, we must by necessity put others first.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: sacrifice

quote: To incessantly blame others for my shortcomings is cowardice borne of fear, fed by fear, and haunted by fear. To be steadfastly accountable for my shortcomings is bravery borne of God, fed by God, and blessed by God.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: accountability, blaming, bravery, fear, god, justification, mistakes, projection, rationalization, shortcomings

quote: The very places that we presume God not to be are the very places that are filled with His footprints and littered with His fingerprints.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: abandoned, abandonment, absence, absent, alone, banish, banished, difficulties, fingerprints, footprints, god, isolated, isolation, lonely, trials

quote: We opt to be seen as ‘right’ in the eyes of everyone else, rather than doing what’s ‘right’ in light of the situation.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: ethics

quote: I paved the path to the very place I don’t want to be. But passing the blame off to someone else doesn’t put me any place else.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: authored, blame, blaming, chart, charted, consequence, create, created, designed, destination, justification, justify, location, path, pave, paved, projecting, rationalization, rationalize, result

quote: If the truth gets in the way, I will remove it. But truth be told, removing the truth never removes the truth.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: agenda, arrogance, arrogant, control, convenience, convenient, deceived, fooled, priorities, removal, remove, removing, truth, truthful, truthfulness
